description:
Just a heads up, waiter service is only during dinner. At lunch, you're supposed to pick up your own utensils and food at the front counter.

We started with the fries and baba ganoush. The sauce for the fries and the flavor of the baba ganoush was amazing. They kept bringing over more bread for the dips when we would run out which was great.

I ordered the chicken kebab plate for my entree. I was amazed how how large the plate was for $12.00. The chicken was juicy and the flavor/marinade was amazing. My plate came with a side of rice, hummus, salad, and lavash bread. My rice had some marinade/sauce on it which was delicious and tarte. The hummus was also super flavorful and one of my favorites that I've ever had. The plate is actually very versatile. You can make a wrap using the lavash, you can have chicken and rice, chicken and salad, or just chicken on its own. I ended up having leftovers and took the rest home.

Overall, service and food was great! You definitely get a lot of bang for your buck. Parking was also easy to find. We found parking right in the front and since we came for dinner, parking was free! Score! The only thing missing in this with all the decor might be some hookah, haha.
author: Love K.

description:
My fiancé and I dined here on Saturday for lunch and absolutely loved it! We randomly stumbled upon this amazing place while kitchen cabinet shopping (what fun that was...)! I highly recommend this place! 

We were greeted by Renee who was also the cook and server. He literally ran the entire place with a smile on his face the entire time. He was super friendly and just an all around nice person. Given that, the service deserves 10 stars!

The food was excellent! We shared the meze appetizer platter and my fiancé had the lamb shawarma, which he said was amazing. I highly recommend the babaganoush (eggplant appetizer) and the hummus - both high in flavor and absolutely delish. 

Besides the food and amazing service, the ambiance was incredible. I can't wait to come back here with a few friends and dine in their beautiful area where you dine on the floor!
author: Anastasia N.

description:
I went to Saffron 685 shortly after they opened up and got the shwarma wrap. It didn't taste as good and as fresh I would have hoped. 

Also, I didn't appreciate the tone of the gentleman at the cashier. It all made sense after reading the responses from the owner on Yelp.
author: Adam L.

description:
The best Mediterranean's food I've had in San Francisco. It was delightful and tasty. We ordered the beef kabap plate and Maza app (babaganush, taboleh, and dolmema) - my fav. Desserts are ba must try: Kafona, sesame cookie, and Turkish delight. All were incredible. 

Plus great service!
author: Sinath N.

description:
Nope.... Never going back again!! Below average food for above average price. 

I ordered the chicken wrap in lavash($ 10.95). It looked extra ordinary and huge. But in that footlong wrap there was 3 pieces of chicken and a whole lot of potatoes and other veggies. It felt like a vegetable wrap. There was a mix up with our orders too. But the server kept on insisting he was right, we got confused. Two things were really good here: the red pepper dip and the lavash... but overall a huge let down.
author: Tania C.

description: Excellent Mediterranean food at an unreasonably reasonable price. All the classics done well with a solid selection for a pescatarian. Service was fantastic & very charming. Restaurant has comfy low couch seating for groups which adds a nice touch.
author: Colin S.

description: Hidden place on Townsend, I came here on Saturday night with a few friends & it was a blast, stellar food & quick service, started with the sampler Mezée trio appetizer, it has fire spicy, Moroccan carrot & red pepper pomegranate walnut dip, all unique, we shared three entrées: bbq prawns, beef steak & the lamb kebab, one of a kind, l was afraid when ordering the lamb but surprisingly was so good and tender, the carry a good wine, ask for the wine list, l had to order a bottle of clos de L'artoir des papes, couldn't resist the temptation, will definitely be back.
author: Aida S.

description: Honestly the best Mediterranean food in the entire city. I think I've tried it all. I used to order very regularly on Uber Eats. But in the past month I've had at least 10 orders cancelled after they are "preparing" the food in the app. Maybe they're too busy? If they are they should just turn off the app. This is a terrible experience. I'm grateful for the good experiences of the past. But I'm very disappointed with them at the moment. Sent with love.
author: Eoghan M.

description:
My husband and I live in the neighborhood and grab dinner here on a regular basis, sometimes eating in the restaurant and sometimes getting take out. It's really quick, convenient, and low key - and there's always a table open in case you want to swing by at the last minute. 

The food has been generally delicious (pretty standard Mediterranean fare) and the prices reasonable for San Francisco (with generous helpings). I usually get the shawerma or falafel plate and have food left over. No complaints about the service.
author: Jennifer W.

description: This was my first time in!  I work down the street and have been looking for new, Delicious places to eat for lunch.  I wondered into Saffron 685 to have the most FANTASTIC food.  YUMMMMM!! I ordered the Veggie Kabab Plate.  Everything was cooked beautifully!  It's a lot of food and I was hungry!!  HIGHLY SUGGESTED!!
author: Jaime C.

description:
I really enjoyed the shwarma plate and the red hummus appetizer spread was delicious. 

This place is great for for a dinner date or some other sort of small intimate get together and the atmosphere is great.

I personally see this becoming a regular place for me to eat at.
author: James P.

description:
Why is this place never packed?! I am really surprised since the food is absolutely delicious!
If you haven't been here you are missing out! :)
author: Ariana V.

description:
We walked over for lunch one day. It had plenty of seats open for lunch which was a good thing. We both have other homes. His is right next to a busy street that has Sunday farmer's market and often filled ethnic eats and Asian shoppers, the real Chinatown as they would call it, and I'm in a similar situation but a different neighborhood, and on occasion we would meet up in this neighborhood. Saffron is a nice little neighborhood restaurant that served non threatening middle eastern, mediterranean food. 

For lunch we would order a wrap, and a shawarma salad. He had a side yogurt dip which I thought I could have made for him, and perhaps even better but he was happy with the restaurant version. It was a sunny early afternoon. I have known him for longer than most and there was that sense of comfort you get from knowing someone so long and so many secrets that are no longer so, that you can just sit and eat and chat about nothing. I don't have many friends, and more importantly, I don't have a lot of time. It's important to choose who you dine with carefully when you don't have much of those things, and I think where to dine makes a difference. This is a quiet, conversation facilitation friendly place nestled between a Michelin (Omakase) and a Michelin wanna be (Khai). I have been to both, and felt this little diner seems to outperform its fancier neighbors in its solid food offerings and better restaurant ambience. 

I recently ordered a take out from here again. I called the restaurant and they had prepared the food and then called the delivery service to make sure that my food got delivered on time. They were very pleasant on the phone and greeted me by my name. It could serve as a good alternative for home cooking. I will be back.
author: Victoria E.

description:
Sleepy Saturday in Showplace Square.  At 11 am the place was 100% empty which was up our alley because we didn't savor dealing with the Brunch crowd. The menu is loaded with tons of vegan and vegetarian options that are famously Mediterranean. The stars were the Tabouli,
Grape leaves and (sorry not sorry) the hand cut French Fries with the balsamic aioli. The warm grapes were complimented by lemon zest. Yum. Highly recommend if you want a quiet lunch with vegan options.
author: Marcy H.

description:
The food quality is actually a solid 3-4 star, but the service was truly terrible. The guy seemed really nice, but it was pretty atrocious.

I was going to say I'd consider stopping by here if I needed a quick Meditteranean fix in the future, but I read some of the childish retaliation from the owner in response to some of the low reviews, so I will 100% avoid this place on principle alone in the future.

EDIT: owner replied as expected. 10/10.

Why ask for wine if you don't have wine? Why would you ask for our preferences on drinks or food if you're not going to follow through on any of them? The server constantly forgot to bring us items, miscounted plates / utensils constantly, didn't bother taking or addressing any of our common custom requests. It was truly one of the worst services I've received, but the dude at least seemed nice...
author: Kevin C.

description: I came here for a meal with a group after visiting Room & Board up the street. Our wonderful host and cook for the evening was René, and he treated us excellently as the last walk in of the evening. He was very attentive to our special orders (some of us avoiding gluten and dairy) and served us a trio of tender lamb kebab plates, with a tasty side appetizer of the Moroccan carrot dip and a pomegranate spritzer. The flavours were lovely and the food fresh. Highly recommended!
author: Ayden G.

description:
My brother and I ate at Saffron 685 prior to going to a Giants game at the end of September. We shared the Shawerma Plate, a Fattoush salad with feta cheese and a Tabouleh salad with added olive oil and lemon. All the dishes were excellent. This restaurant is better than most I have tried from Santa Cruz to San Francisco. Recommended highly.
Robert
author: Robert O.

description: Walked in for lunch and the restaurant was empty and no employees in site. When a guy with an apron finally came out and said he was short staffed and could only make the food to go.... didn't even offer to let us sit down. Very rude attitude from what seemed like a manager or owner
author: Mark B.

description: I love the falafel wrap here, and the guy who runs the place is super nice. They also serve beer, which is handy.
author: Branson S.

description:
DO NOT ORDER CHICKEN. We went last night to Saffron 685 around 7pm and the place was virtually empty. One of the entrees we ordered was the chicken kebab. When it arrived I stabbed a fork in a piece of chicken and the fork pierced the meat with the same feeling it pierces raw chicken. I then cut it and the knife tore thru the meat. It didn't look raw, tho, so I asked my girlfriend what she thought. She cut another and it was clearly raw, so we brought it up with the staff member (just one person there). He begrudgingly agreed to remake it, hardly caring about us showing him raw chicken. This was honestly the first time I've sent food back (I get way too nervous).

15 min later he brought out another plate and clarified that it is breast meat. It felt like he was saying that's why it has that texture. Once again, my fork went thru it with the same feel. We inspected and couldn't find any evidence of rawness. I ate one piece, but I couldn't eat anymore. The texture was too much for me. The rest of the food was fine, but that hardly makes up for it. He didn't ask how the new plate was or show any care for our experience (no other comments, no comping of anything, etc).
author: Nathan C.

description: The best Mediterranean food in town for sure. Always high standards in quality of food as well as service, ingredients always fresh and prices are reasonable, will be a regular.
author: Elmir A.

description: I have been going to this place for the last 8 years. It has been a consistent lunch spot for me. Although I don't love every item on the menu, their lamb shawarma and lamb kebab wraps are very delicious and reasonably priced. Definitely check out if you are in the neighborhood!
author: Sedat A.

description:
This place will give you food poisoning. My husband and I visited it yesterday and we both got sick because of the food. I suspect unhygenic food preparations because we both have no allergies. On top of it the service was so bad and the owner has no regard for serving crappy food. I regret eating here and will ensure that none of my friends and family ever enter this place again.

Edit: This atrocious owner has the audacity to talk crap after putting my family through such difficulties. I've seen her replies on other posts and now I get how she is trying to blame the victim by talking irrelevant nonsense. I didnt visit her restaurant on 1st Aug. Please read her replies before deciding to visit this godforsaken place.
author: Rana B.

description:
As delicious as ever. I hadn't been in years & it was fantastic. I had the falafel and shawarma salad. The falafel was so tasty I had to get a second order. The man had the chicken wrap in some yummy lavash bread. The babe shared the falafel and had latkes, her favorite.
The service was friendly. Even gave the babe a Turkish delight!  Desserts are made in house so we had to go home with some baklava. Mmmmmm.
author: Heather S.

description: Fabulous! Home made from scratch yogurt, baklava, dips like babaganoush and my favorite, his red pepper dip. Hard to make fresh - Saffron has a fantastic kitchen. Approachable, spotless. Cool Moroccan floor cushions plus sofas and regular seating - great options for socializing. Menu on their website. Wine and beer. Take out too. Owner obviously proud, committed to his craft, culture, and customers.
author: monica p.

description: Just stopped by here for a quick meal with my boyfriend. He had Shawarma (lamb) wrap and I had chicken Kebob plate, plus pomegranate spritzer and Turkish coffee. Everything was delicious, we also ordered tzatziki with pita, which is a favorite of mine and it hit the spot. My chicken kebab was perfect and juicy and not overcooked, which was nice because most of the time I find kebobs to be more dry and tough, but this was perfect. Place was clean and had nice comfy, hidden-gem type decor. But truly it was our awesome waiter who made the visit so special! Such a cool guy, funny, charming, and helped my boyfriend pick his meal in terms of recommending which meat would be better as a wrap. Will definitely be back!
author: Savannah L.

description:
We ate here and ordered the shawarma, the dolmas, baba ganoush and hummus, then we finished with wonderful desserts and splending coffee.
All the food we ordered was absolutely delicious and served at a timely fashion. The service was excellent, professional yet friendly.
author: Oscar O.

description: The place is super clean and food taste really good. We ordered the Falafel plate and Shawarma Lamb Wrap. The person who helped us was very helpful and personable. I will come back for sure. Also, entered parking is very easy to find here. Two thumbs up here!
author: Jake M.

description: Renee made me up something super tasty when I showed up after the kitchen was closed. Great service, kind guy, great falafel wrap.
author: Torben U.

description:
Lamb Shawarma is AMAZING. HUGE PORTION.
Renee is a great host. 
Will definitely go again.
author: Ronil A.

description: One of my favorite Mediterranean food places in SoMa. I come here often for lunch and their falalel wraps are pretty awesome. Would for sure recommend this place.
author: Vikhyat C.

description: My wife and I are traveling from North Carolina. We stopped in for a quick lunch. We were very pleasantly surprised!!! The food was absolutely delicious. Service was outstanding. By far the best tasting Mediterranean cuisine I have experienced.
author: Benjamin H.

description: 0 stars if I could. I just got a takeout order and it was TERRIBLE. I ordered the lamb kebab wrap which was huge and with literally only 3 pieces of actual meat and a bunch of just veggies and other stuff. Not good. Ordered a soup that was cold along with everything else, and didn't even get any silverware to eat it with. The French fries on the side were about the only thing I ate. Would not recommend.
author: C M.

description:
This place is truly awesome. Very authentic and the vibe inside is very satisfying. 
The lamb shawarma here is the best I've had and they have a ton of other options too. The portion size is huge enough to feed the Hulk. 

Tip: Take a pilsner with your meal and I bet you'll come back for more
author: Sahil A.

description: Went to San Francisco for a conference and got some amazing Mediterranean food! The decorations and seating were lovely and the food was even better. Had a lot of vegan and gluten free options, would highly recommend.
author: Jordanne K.

description: Superb Mediterranean and Turkish cuisine. Great red pepper dip and dolmas. The kabobs and the falafel were outstanding. Very flavorful. Great service. Would come here again. Great food.
author: Deborah H.

description: Loved the food and different varietes of appetizers and desserts here. The owner is very friendly. Nice hospitality and ambience. As a vegetarian, I rarely get to see many options in menu. But this place had close to 20-25 vegetarian options. Everything was so tasty. Highly recommend this place.
author: Aditi P.

description: If you love taste of good Mediterranean food and service this is the place to come very clean
author: Mahgoub E.

description: This is an amazing place. Nice owner! Fresh food. The rose candy he made is really testy. Five stars experience.
author: Gabbie Z.

description: Pretty no-frills place for Mediterranean. The carrot dip was really good and our veggie kebabs were fine. Nothing spectacular, but would come back to try the lamb. The waiter was a little sassy and funny, so it made our experience unique.
author: Geri W.

description: I am so happy to have found this place! There are a lot of options in the area, but many of the restaurants along this strip either have super long waits or don't have good service. It was refreshing to walk in and be pleasantly greeted, then well taken care of throughout my entire meal. The good was also great - I had the Lamb Kebab plate, but there are a variety of options ranging from health to comfort food. The décor was very nice, and overall it had an enjoyable ambiance. I am looking forward to going back soon!
author: Rebecca M.

description: Friendliest owner, great dessert, relaxed vibe,  and perfectly spiced Mediterranean food. Will definitely come back.
author: Jonathan G.

description: Great Mediterranean find!! Got the lamb combo plate and it was delicious. Lots of food and amazing flavors. Glad I came by! Will come back.
author: Lisa L.

description:
We've lived just feet away from this place for two years and only just managed to try it out. Shameful that we haven't stayed more local and regretful that we've been missing out for so long! 

Ordering is easy, the service is friendly and quick, and the food is delicious, made with very fresh tasting ingredients (we had lamb and chicken kebab plates). This place makes a great alternative to staying home and cooking, without breaking the bank.
author: John R.

description:
DON'T eat at this unhygenic and dirty restaurant. My whole body swelled up and I got fever. I was starving today and made the terrible mistake of ordering at this place. I ordered the falafel platter and as soon as I ate it I started to swell on my face. The swelling proceeded to my face and body and then I also started feeling feverish. The doc said it was a case of rotten food that was served to me. 
Completely AVOID this shitty place IF YOU DON'T WANT TO GET SICK.

I just went through the reviews and I saw a couple others that have faced similar situations and got sick just like me. This restaurant must be CLOSED DOWN immediately.
author: Ilyas M.

description: Looking for a place to have a relaxing 5 star meal? This is definitely my go-to for Mediterranean, the salmon fillet plate is always cooked to perfection and the quality of everything is what you should expect at every restaurant. The hummus is creamy and smooth, salad is always fresh and all of the portions are adequately balanced.
author: Victor H.

description: Saffron 685 is such a find! Amazing Turkish food, in a casual neighborhood setting, without the insane crowds! We could actually have a conversation without screaming... SCORE! We've been there a few times and the chicken kebab is our favorite, with the falafel coming in as a close second. You will not go away hungry -- the portions are quite generous. Eating here reminds me of traveling in Turkey, not only because of the food but because Saffron 685 is REAL, with great food made to order. Renee is the host, who seems quiet at first, but once you talk to him, you see immediately he's a great guy and eager to please. If you want terrific food in a casual neighborhood setting, this is the place!
author: Sue H.

description:
I was looking for a lunch place at 3PM (i know!) and luckily they were open. I had their amazing salmon filet plate which was freshly cooked and came with hummus, salad and beans - so healthy and nutritious!!
The place has a nice cozy ("family"?) vibe to it, the food feels very "authentic" and delicious, the staff very accommodating and friendly. 
I will definitely be back!
author: Irena S.

description:
I love Saffron 685! Their falafel is exceptionally good, and the staff is all very friendly. Most importantly, they have the best baklava in the Bay Area. 

Their tea, Turkish Delight, and mint lemonade is all top notch as well. Highly recommended!
author: Patrick C.

description: Very nice place and delicious food also a very good service , try the homemade juice ( lemonade )
author: Abdoul W.

description: Great food and friendly service. We especially liked the hummus, falafels and fries. Great combo! Also, treat yourself to the mint lemonade, it's delicious and a great treat on a hot day.
author: Kalie M.

description:
The worst place ever!!!!! I usually don't like to post bad reviews but this restaurant pushed me beyond my limit !!!!  Just want to tell you what happened with me before I tell you what happened with other people there !!!!!!! First the food was horrible and taste old and nasty !!!! Second they robbed me by charging the credit card 4 times and I had to call my credit card to get my money back after I gave up talking to the people in this restaurant since they are the rudest people on earth including the manager and the tall guy there that looks Persian and never wants to say his name or wear his name badge !!!!! And to know about what happened there I was seating there with my family and my family's friends and two old black ladies in mid 90 came to the restaurant with a small cute service dog and they approached them and lied and said oh we closed then he pushed them out of the door however it was 2 pm and they close at 9 pm and it is illegal to refuse serving people because of their color or disability !! I hope they sue them !! 

This restaurant in one sentence
 Most aggressive people most rude people worst food and they will rob you all for 19.99 !!
author: Arnold Y.

description: Good portion sizes and excellent food. I'll be coming back! I would recommend the shawarma wrap or kebabs.
author: Michael B.

description: Wonderful Mediterranean restaurant. Got the lamb plate and found the meat cooked perfectly, makes me salivate now just thinking about it...okay, going to order takeout.
author: Ryan M.

description:
I had the green pepper dip with pita bread and the falafel wrap. The wrap was SO GOOD. The bread part was crisp on one side, which I'd never had before. Usually falafel wraps are just soft and sometimes soggy, but this one wasn't! And the filling was great too, with hot falafels! The portions are pretty big, so I was definitely stuffed by the end and had leftovers for later.

The restaurant was mostly empty since I went on a weekday for dinner, but the guy who worked there was super friendly and provided great service. I wish I found this place sooner!
author: Maya R.

description: I've come here off and on for nearly a decade. They have always been kind and maintained the quality of food at a reasonable price. Im a big fan of the wraps and the sweets.
author: Bashir Z.

description: A Mediterranean restaurant far beyond the ordinary.  After shopping at REI we had a hankering for Mediterranean food and we were delighted to find this place right around the corner.  I imagine this place is very busy with workers from Zynga and Adobe during the day, but in the evening it was a very quiet and pleasant spot.  The food was consistently far superior to comparable Mediterranean/Middle Eastern places around town, from the pita and lavash to the tabbouleh to the shawarma.  We particularly loved the pomegranate/walnut/red pepper dip, but it seems you can't go wrong with the menu.  The service was extremely friendly.  Highly recommended.
author: Victor O.

description: We happened into Saffron 685 when looking at a nearby college. The ambience is very welcoming and warm. We got the chicken kebab, lamb kebab, and meza appetizer plate. All three were amazing. The hummus alone was the best I have ever tasted. The pomegranate spritzers went perfectly with the meal. This was topped by the waiter who was so kind and made our experience that much more enjoyable. I look forward to coming back whenever I make it up here!
author: Heather K.

description: Quick lunchtime falafel that had just the right amount of sauce, hummus and the wrap was nicely toasted to give it a great texture. I will go back.
author: Todd S.

description: Love this!! Came here after work and was pleasantly surprised! We got the prawns kebab plate and chicken kebab plate to go. Portions were big, and the flavors of everything were delicious! Loved the salad and baba ganoush especially! We also got the mint lemonade, so refreshing. The baklava were also delicious. I was sad we didn't stay to eat either; the couches and tables were roomy and comfy. Zero complaints about this meal, will be back!
author: Melissa W.

description: This restaurant is calm, serene and with zero pressure. The food is freshly made by the owner on the spot. The dishes are flavorful and authentic. It is a place that one can enjoy a lovely meal and leisurely conversation. It is a rare place to enjoy delicious food with a glass of good wine.
author: Qi Z.

description: This is the best lunch spot in the area. While it's quick service, there is no quality compromise. Fresh and high quality everytime (I've been coming here for years). Renee is concious of every detail down to the finishing spices. Very fairly priced, too!
author: Joshua G.

description: It was a lovely dinner, the spot is a hidden gem, freshly prepared food & budget friendly!  Not many good Mediterranean Turkish restaurant in San Francisco, so many dips to choose from, spicy green pepper dip and the lamb kebabs melt in your mouth. Amazing! My new destination for Turkish food, We will be coming back.
author: Erkin A.

description: What a gem! I was looking for a cozy spot with fresh, healthy comfort food and this was perfect. Their lamb was so well spiced and the veggies perfectly cooked. Loved their dips!  I am so excited to know this place is here! Will be back often.
author: Willow R.

description: This is an amazing place to have a drink. The back room is so private and relaxing. They have the best fries in town!
author: Maria W.

description: This restaurant is very understated and always seemed a bit empty when I walked by.  So, I didn't try it for awhile.  Once I decided to, I was not disappointed.  The food tasted fresh, authentic, and well seasoned.  I've tried the chicken kabob plate and the lamb shawarma plate.  Both were really good portions and super delicious!
author: Corey H.

description: Amazing food. Everything we ordered was very fresh and I love the service. I look forward to coming back to try other dishes.
author: Chris J.

description: Great tabouleh and fresh salad dressings. Great lamb and shawarma! We will come back next time we are in the area. Friendly service and handmade
author: Nappy N.

description: LOVE THIS PLACE!! incredible food and the guy was great! he cooked, served and altered some of the menu options and it was amazing.
author: Jacquelyn A.

description: Love the shawarma salad with feta cheese here, owner is friendly, my wife and I both like the food. One of the few places in the city where like the meat quality is nice if u r getting gyro meat.
author: Amendra K.

description: Really, super delicious food!! My friend and I split the latkes, which were gorgeously crispy and golden. We got the appetizer plate and enjoyed everything with the yummy, warm pita. The lamb schwarma plate was probably my favorite thing we ordered. The salad and rice and lavash that came with it were all delicious as well. The man in charge was very friendly and spent some time talking with my friend and I since it was a quieter moment at the restaurant. We really enjoyed and will be back!!
author: Kristin R.

description: Wow this place is very tasty food. I.will be back again I really enjoyed the lamb kabob plate. Tasted very healthy and with fresh ingredients. Baklava was perfect. Give it a try)
author: Henry L.

description: I ordered the chicken kabob plate and it was delicious much better than other Mediterranean food i have tried in SF. I also had the baba ganoush and latkes which were tasty as well. Great service from the girl behind the counter. Recommended.
author: Eugene S.

description: This place is a hidden gem as far as Mediterranean cuisine goes. Very fresh and high quality ingredients plus great customer service. I do plan to come back here especially for the wild caught salmon plate.
author: Emily B.

description: I can not judge the food in this place but, obviously, the people who run it are not all there. We walked into an empty, totally empty restaurant. All tables were empty. The person at the counter asked us to sit down at the table across from the main counter, but we asked him if we could sit at another table 7 feet from it. The guy told us we could not sit there. I asked him if it was reserved, and he a said that section was closed. A section? First of all, it was NOT even a section, it was a table literally seven feet away from the one he had offered to us.  I guess it is more important to him that an income. May be they run a charity, can not tell and will not come back.
author: Sophie N.

description:
We went to Saffron 685 for a late lunch / early dinner on our last night in San Francisco before returning to Atlanta. 

The meal did not disappoint! Rene was attentive and whipped up everything we ordered fresh - the roasted red pepper dip is to die for. (He gave us an extra helping of grilled pita too!)

We got the lamb kabobs, grilled salmon, and the Shawerma wrap. It was SO much food and for such a good price.

Everything was cooked to perfection and we even got to drink a bottle of wine we picked up in Napa. 

Definitely worth the visit, for in town peeps or out of towners!
author: Courtney L.

description: Amazing authentic Mediterranean fusion food!! And awesome cozy atmosphere at great prices! This is a hidden gem in Soma
author: Aylee N.

description: I work across the street and decided to try this place out. Ordered their chicken kabob and it's amazing. Really tasty and juicy. Since I'm carb dieting, I like to order the kabobs on the side. Service is great, and they make their food fresh. I highly recommend!
author: Ron K.

description: This place is awesome! I had the Shawarma wrap. The lamb was perfectly tender, overloaded with fresh hummus and a crisp wrap. It was pretty filling and great value for money. Plus some great conversation with the owner. Worth trying out!
author: Nitin J.

description: Very fun find. Great food and very friendly staff. A cute place to relax and enjoy who your with.
author: Christine L.

description: This place was decent. It was pretty late not much else was open. Don't waste your money on the extra $2 for feta to add to a sale it was literally a sprinkle.
author: Jillian G.

description: Delicious lamb plate and presentation and corgi friendly!!! Great treats for the dog!
author: Yosun C.

description:
Great menu, pretty decent prices, excellent service, lots of different types of Turkish flare with a twist. 
Best way to sample the food here is order them like tapas and then try them all, It is a great way to try new foods in this way if you haven't had it before!
The mint lemonade freshly made in the house with no sugar add it and it is so refreshing. 
you could bring your own bottle of wine for a small uncorking fee, totally worth it. 
Food comes out pretty fast. 
Different soups, l like the roasted tomato eggplant red pepper soup, comes in a big ball. Nice flavor & totally vegetarian. All in all great experience.
author: Jorge B.

description: I will be sad to not be able to come here every noon for lunch because our office is moving. If you work/live around I would definitely recommend them.
author: Cagdas T.

description: A friendly small business! We live in the neighborhood so we often get take-out for dinner. Husband always gets the shawerma wrap and I love the latkes. We recommend this place highly!
author: Alyssa D.

description: The latkes are unreal!  Crunchy exterior and soft insides. The dolmas are out of this world!  The marinade that Rene uses on the Beef Kabobs is Fantastic. Friendly service. Great music too!
author: Joseph C.

description: I've been here 3 times now and it never ceases to disappoint! Great quality food, very reasonable prices, and the owner Renee is very friendly and welcoming as well! Can't say enough good things about this place, new-ish to the Bay and I'll definitely become a regular here!
author: Rich K.

description: I've been coming to Saffron for years. Since before all the OTHER tech companies moved in, Saffron has been my secret lunch place, the place to go for real conversations, to sit on a pillow on the floor, with a tiny super-strong coffee and my shawarma salad, picking away at the problems of the universe. I adore it here, the staff are kind and remember me, and the service is swift. Get the delicious fresh lemonade, but please don't take my seat in the back corner. :)
author: Marisa L.

description:
Absolutely incredible service. We came late in the evening and Renee helped us by making a delicious meal. The service was great, he joked around with us, and we had a real genuine conversation. Morrigan and Cian say hello, and thanks again.

Seriously, go here.
author: Morrigan R.

description: What a wonderful place for food and service.  My fiancee and I wandered into here, both hungry and tired as we just returned from a long weekend of camping.   We wanted some comfort food - we received that, and some wonderfully personal service as well.  The server, who's also the cook, was delightfully friendly and funny.  The food he prepared - we had the lamb kebab and the falafel plate - was fantastic.   The lamb was succulent.   The tabouleh was particularly flavorful.  We wound up talking with him about how he prepares things and how he gets fresh ingredients from local farmers markets.  We will definitely go again some time soon.
author: Sid S.

description: Clean food with perfect balance of protein, greens, cheese. One of those random visit which makes you plan for the next visit to stop here.
author: Hari T.

description:
A nice spot for tasty dinner. Loved the lamb kabob and the potato latka. The chef, Renee', is very personable and took good care of us.

Ambience is nice, with couches and pillows and low lighting. Good wine for a good price, too.  Try the Turkish coffee as well.
author: Irina B.

description: I used to eat here quite often when I worked at Adobe. My go tos were the falafel wrap and chicken shawarma wrap. Always cooked fresh, easily customizable to get extra sauces as desired. Can take a bit longer than some of the other lunch places in the area because they do cook to order vs some other Mediterranean places that prepare shawarma ingredients in bulk much in advance but I always found it worth it. The owner
author: Jason M.

description: This place is a hidden gem! The food is so good, best tender beef kabob and well marinated chicken kabob. The desserts are so good, the baklava with pistachios and the one with walnuts are always fresh. The people working here are so friendly, we had a great time.
author: H M.

description: The BEST. Absolute best Mediterranean/Middle Eastern food in SF, period end of story. My partner and I drive all the way from Ocean Beach (30 min drive) to devour all the delicious, fresh, organic eats. You really can't go wrong with anything on the menu, but my favorites include the Salmon (wild caught) fillet plate, the Shawerma plate/wrap, the Manaesh Za'atar plate, the and ALL the salads especially. So so fresh and delicious. The deserts, Turkish coffee, mint lemonade & Moroccan tea are also a MUST have. I could go on and on about this place, so do yourself a favor and check it out! Cheers!
author: Ahna K.

description: The chicken wrap was real good and real big. Baklava was very fresh and delicious. Owner was very friendly and very helpful. Definitely coming back.
author: Peter G.

description: This is the freshest food! I am Romanian so our cuisine is very similar, it feels like I am at home. Honestly even the vegetables I crave. Amazing food, wine selection and even a soup and some desserts. What more could you ask for?
author: Christina B.

description: Awesome place for Mediterranean food. The food is excellent, both in terms of quality and the portions they give you. The place has a modern, yet authentic feeling that is laid back and comfortable. The staff are very friendly and helpful. Overall, my go-to place for Mediterranean food.
author: Jack D.

description:
My family stops by whenever we're in the area! 

Their pomegranate bell pepper dip is delicious, and an excellent start to the Mediterranean feast we indulge in when we come. Their kebabs are perfectly spiced, their coffee is strong, and their house-made desserts (Turkish delights, nougat, baklava) are rich and satisfying. 

I highly recommend!
author: Shaun S.

description:
Awesome food with super friendly and quick service.  My new favorite lunch spot!

I have had the shawarma and my friend has had the falafel wrap and both were really good.
author: Rachel S.

description: This is a great spot for a quick meal.  Very reasonably priced and the food is solid.
author: beach m.

description: My favorite thing about this place is the ambiance. It blends the line perfectly between cozy and professional. Great for dinner with a couple friends or a causal business lunch. Everything is spiced to perfection and I always leave feeling full yet light - my favorite part of mediterranean eats! Super friendly staff that takes pride in getting to know their customers!
author: Kevin F.

description: It was a great find, we had the Wild Salmon with exotic blend of beans, 2 types of barbecued lamb and chicken on a sticks with saffron rice, for dessert the Konafa which was amazing and Torino type nougat but on the soft side, we were told it was made out of egg white, rosewater, almond and pistachio it was good too.  Worth coming back.
author: Lena C.

description: Amazing food! Healthy but flavorful. Had the chicken which was so good I ended up ordering beef and lamb to take out for the family. Place is casual and homey. Will definitely be back. Highly recommend this place!
author: TC D.

description: One of my favorite cafes around. Prompt, friendly service, and there are plenty of vegetarian and vegan options. Every dish I've had is excellent - especially the falafel and dolmas. I definitely recommend this spot!
author: Chip S.

description: The place is a hidden gem, l had today the kebab mixed plate with the freshly mint lemonade, both were fantastic, l finished the lunch with konafa.
author: Yahia M.

description: Really really good! Highly recommended! Try the chicken skewers or the lamb both are really tasty! Great service as well :)
author: Marianna D.

description: I've enjoyed Saffron 685 for the past five years and the food is always consistently fresh and tasty.  A nice selection of drinks, appetizers, sandwiches, entrees and desserts.  They have the best chicken kebobs that are cooked to perfection every time.  Renee is pleasant and the service is wonderful.  Love the decor too.   Fantastic for lunch or when I don't feel like cooking dinner.  All around great place to have in the neighborhood !
author: Charmane C.

description: We came here on Saturday night right before closing the server we spoke to was gracious, we sat on the low Moroccan table with large cushion pillows, love the ambiance, cozy and casual, food was superb, quality and quantity, prices fairly reasonable for San Francisco, only thing they were out of Konafa dessert.
author: Bilel A.

description:
This place is a little known gem, in my opinion, especially for dinner.  I often stop by here around 6:00 PM to get carry out, although their dining room is also more than comfortable.  The food is very consistent and very tasty.   My personal favorites include the falafel plate and the lamb kebab plate.  But, honestly, I have brought many friends here that ranged from vegetarians to carnivores, and everyone was very happy with whatever they ordered.

Even though during rush hour there is lots of traffic streaming by on Townsend Street, I am always pleasantly surprised that I can usually find parking at one of the meters.  And you don't have to feed the meter after 6:00 PM!

The owner is really dedicated and seems to work endless hours as far as I can tell.  He has lived in the neighborhood for many years, so it is a bonus to feel like I am supporting a local business.

Please give this place a try if you are in the mood for Mediterranean food.  So many of these places are being driven out of business by huge rent increases.  I would really like to see this place get the opportunity to remain a fixture of our neighborhood.  In other words, try it -- you will like it!
author: Conrad S.

description: The chicken kebab plate is great! Also the portions are a good size so it's good value for the money.
author: Loretta J.

description: I came here on a recommendation from a friend and it was lit! It's a beautiful Mediterranean restaurant! They have very delicious and healthy foods. Their portions are very generous and people work there are very friendly.  I highly recommend it!
author: Bendi Y.

description: This review is long overdue, I've been coming to this place for about 10 years and it never disappoints! The food is delicious, nice easy going atmosphere, the owner is very friendly and is always nice to chat with as is the staff. Whenever I'm in the area I make it a point to stop by for a meal, everything on the menu is delicious!
author: Elizabeth C.

description: Saffron 685 is fantastic! Always surprised that no seems to know about it! Cannot go wrong with the Falafel plate or wrap!
author: William G.

description:
Went there for lunch today with my coworkers and we all ordered wraps.  All of our wraps had 2 pieces of meat each, a ton of hummus and nothing much else.  My friend asked for hot sauce and they charged him .50 cents for a tablespoon of hotsauce.

We were sitting at our table and we asked for water.  They placed the glasses of water by the cash register and waved at us to tell us to pick up our water from the cash register.
author: Francis B.

description: Good food and inviting ambience. The salmon was delicious as well as the hummus. Definitely will be coming back.
author: Kiki H.

description:
A family member got very sick on the food here. Pity, because it tasted ok. We ordered the mezza platter and some other items.

The comments from the manager below show how little the restaurant cares about their customers. They sent me a private comment asking for more details and expressing concern, but for some reason wants to pass this off as an allergy! Amazing! Dealing with food safety professionally is part of running a restaurant business!
author: Lavy S.

description: Saffron 685 gets 5 stars from me for two reasons: delicious food and the lack of excellent Mediterranean (Middle Eastern) restaurants in the area. The Shawerma plate is especially good, and generous. There's a wine and beer selection, although I go for the Moroccan mint tea, and great desserts.
author: Greg T.

description:
Nice Turkish place, I came here on an advice of a friend who said that  is one of her favorite restaurant in San Francisco. We were still pleasantly surprised by the relaxed, informal tone of the decor and the staff. 
There is nothing fussy or stiff here. The meal was worth every penny. Food was original full of favor, there is a Moroccan accent to many of the dishes, in the spicing if not in the ingredients. 
The service was perfect for my taste, attentive, friendly, comfortable, and exquisite lay timed, many dips and spreads, beets crunchy walnut & pomegranate walnut red pepper dips are both top notch. 
Server was patient with us she explained a lot about the food and made recommendations, but would leave us alone to enjoy the whole experience. Perfect.
author: Marina S.

description: Renee is a master and this place is his temple of Zen. He works like a machine yet manages to humanize himself casting doubt on the denied claims of sentient AI by tech giants. The food looks and tastes like something out of a Star Trek replicator. Rather unreal.
author: Sneha N.

description:
I ordered the lamb kebab plate and the Moroccan spiced hot chocolate. The lamb kebab plate was excellent. 

I can't say much about the Moroccan spiced hot chocolate, because I didn't feel comfortable drinking it. I used UberEats, and when it arrived there was a good 2 inches between the drink and the lid. Did it spill in the car on the way over? Was the driver drinking it? Was it a medium drink in a large cup? Given that there was no saran wrap between the drink and the lid, and no tape over the lid spout, I decided to just not drink it. 

When I called the restaurant the nice person who answered (a few minutes after closing time actually) explained that the hot cocoa has a foamy top, and they fill it all the way, and that it is expected to go down by the time the delivery happens. Also, there's normally a piece of tape on the lid, but they were particularly busy and it's possible that it didn't get on there. 

This did ease my mind a bit, but still 2+ inches seems like a lot. So, I hope to enjoy this drink sitting in the restaurant someday, and I will definitely not order hot drinks if I end up using UberEats again.
author: LD M.

description: Solid healthy food, they have low carb options as well. Great setup to bring friends for dinner as well!
author: Anand R.

description: This is my everyday lunch spot . Everything is fresh,tasty, and the portions are big .Also the service is very good and quick . Oh and they have the best fries
author: Greg D.

description: It was good food. I especially loved the maza platter. As a Turkish I grew eating lentil/bulgur dish and it reminded me my childhood. I want to mention Renee by name as he was very friendly.
author: Bahadir A.

description:
This place was horrible. One piece of chicken in the salad. They didn't have plastic knifes or apparently knives of any kind to cut/split our wrap because "We don't do that here".

They packaged the food terribly and it leaked all over the place.

Do yourself a favor. Skip a meal rather than eat here.
author: Jason G.

description:
This is one of the more authentic Turkish restaurants in SOMA.  It features a wide assortment of Turkish Mediterranean dips and mazes including not limited red pepper pome dip with walnuts, spicy green pepper dip and organic beet walnut dip, the latter is my favorite. The soup is the perfect dish for a chill night in San Francisco. My first choice will be the roasted red bell w/ grilled eggplant because it is like two meals to me.  When it arrives to the table to slowly enjoy. The grilled wild Salmon and Manaesh Zaater plates are one of the best I've ever had, order the Moroccan mint tea! Hot yet refreshing. Service was very friendly, and they were more than happy to make a substitution for my friend (extra veggies instead of rice with her entree

parking is bad due to all tech companies in the area, however I noticed most restaurants near by don't get busy for dinner! I don't mind as long as the food that good.
author: Mayak A.

description: I ate here all the time when I worked in the neighborhood. Fast forward to two years later, they're food is exactly how I remembered it. Mediterranean plate was my go to. Their lentils are amazing, as well as their fries. Dolmas, hummus, tabouleh were on point as well. The block is constantly changing restaurants, please never leave Saffron 685!!
author: Spamricebacon V.

description: We came in while it was empty at night. I imagine the bulk of its business is done during the lunch rush. The latkes, lamb kebab, mint lemonade, and konafa were all amazing, and service was very prompt, friendly, and attentive.
author: Charles W.

description:
I love this place! I've been meaning to write a review for quite some time as I come here almost 1x a week.

The food is fantastic - fresh and healthy. As a Turkish cuisine the place has many dips - my favorite is the flavorful but not too heavy carrot dip. My go-to order is the fattoush salad topped with feta with falafel on the side. My boyfriend's favorite is the chicken kabab plate.

Call ahead for easy take out or grab a glass of wine and eat with a friend.
author: Lauren F.

description: This is one of my favorite places for lunch. My go-to meal is the falafel wrap and black mint tea. The falafel is always moist and the wrap has veggies and excellent sauce.
author: Martin H.

description: The chicken kebab is delicious. I love the food over there, it's truly authentic Mediterranean food.
author: Manar A.

description: Superb food and service at a perfect price point. Our takeaway order was prepared on time and was delicious. Every item was an invitation to try other new tastes. I highly recommend you explore Saffron 685 and enjoy it  too.
author: Peter B.

description:
My favorite shawarma in the city!  Super fresh and well balanced in flavors.  I work in the area and I've eaten just about everything.  I love Saffron because it's healthy, super tasty, and hearty servings.   
Matching the great food is the great service.  Being greeted with such warmth and kindness always makes me feel good no matter what kind of day I am having.  The love and kindness that I am met with I know is the same that goes into my food.  An easy five stars for me.  Thank you Saffron 685!
author: Larry H.

description: Been coming here for many years. Great place for some falafel and wraps! Excellent lunch option.
author: Dan M.

description:
Stumbled upon this Turkish place in a hungry stupor, and decided to give it a try (after all, Mediterranean places are a dime a dozen on this city). The location is okay, albeit a difficult to find and kind of off the beaten track. The interior is nice and spacious. There was no one in when I came. 

I wanted to get the salmon kebab, but at $17, I didn't think I wanted to spend that amount and get annoyed if it wasn't good. I chose to go with the meza sampler instead, opting for falafel, hummus, and dolma. The hummus is probably some of the best I've had in the city (for some
reason, this city can't get hummus right!!). The falafel was cooked to perfection and the tahini sauce really hit the spot. The dolmas were also delicious.

Of course, I couldn't resist the homemade baklava. SO.DELISH. Nice, flaky, and soft in all the right places.

Some reviews indicated that customer service was lacking, however I feel that a part of this is cultural. With that said, I didn't find the lone employee to be rude in the least bit, but that could be left up to interpretation.

Pros:
-good hummus
-nice selection of options
-homemade baklava (enough said)

Cons:
-a bit inconvenient to find (there's street parking and a closed garage, but otherwise it's a bit hard to find this place).
-some items are a bit overpriced in my opinion
author: Tracy T.

description:
Great place to come and eat, been coming here for many years now and food always taste the same. (Delicious.)
I will highly recommend if you're craving Mediterranean food.
author: Raffi M.

description:
We had a very nice lunch here! 
the restaurant is in the design district, as we went there for lunch, it was full with business people, but it was still a very nice and quiet atmosphere. 

We had grilled Salmon, organic beef steak and BBQ chicken on skewers, for dessert the Konafa with ricotta mozzarella pistachio with a lovely cardamom black tea. 

the staff was nice to explain the menu, and service was fast and courteous would definitely come back here for some good Turkish food.
author: Christina G.

description: Best service and food! Staff was great and food came promptly. The falafels were amazing. Prices were very reasonable as well!
author: Krista K.

description:
I had not come to this side of town in more than 8 years but made sure to drop into Saffron since I was there. It was my favorite lunch spot 10 years ago when I used to go to the Design Center.

I was happy to see that nothing had changed. The food (specifically the shawarma) was as delicious as I'd remembered it. The service was great as always and the ambiance was soothing and welcoming.

It's rare to see a restaurant last this long, especially given the rising rents in this city and the gentrification in that part of town. Kudos to the owner for making it work. The food speaks for itself. If you're near the Design Center, make sure to drop into Saffron and judge for yourself.
author: parissa s.

description: One of my favorite lunch spots.  Falafel is great, staff is friendly and attentive.  Highly recommend!
author: Saran C.

description: I've been coming here for four years since I've worked down the street. Always get the falafel wrap or plate, and they do a great job with friendly service. Very tasty lunch spot!
author: Ariadne R.

description: I always got food delivered through ubereats from this restaurant. Food has always been on point, good and not too long of a wait.
author: Fabio C.

description: Large portions! This place gives you enough food to feed a family. The chicken shwarma is extremely tender and great. It comes with rice and some vegetables as well. I'll be sure to come here next time I'm starving, because it fits the bill for that. Saffron has a quaint interior and offers some nice desserts as well.
author: Zoe Z.

description:
I used Saffron 685 twice for two Happy Hour's I put on for my company. I ordered 2 Mediterranean trays and 1 order of chicken kebabs the morning of the event. It was important that we have healthy, vegetarian options.

Both times, the food was delivered early and the owner made sure to be in touch via text message which, as a busy coordinator, I greatly appreciated. Additionally, the food was exactly the portion-size he had described on the phone (30 ppl) and delicious to boot! I was impressed that the driver managed to keep all of the dips in place, during transit. Nice work!

I will definitely be using them again.
author: Jenny S.

description: This place is amazing value. Seriously. The owner is the nicest guy and I always have great chats and service whenever I visit. The food is delicious and very healthy. And the cost is incredibly reasonable. I would regularly drop by on my way home from work and pick up dinner for my wife and I. Made to order. The salads and falafel are a must along with the carrot dip. Enjoy!
author: Tom H.

description: This place is one of Soma's hidden gems. I usually come in for their shawarma wraps and they are consistently delicious. The meat is really tender and flavorful and is extremely filling too. The ambiance is really cozy and feels completely disconnected and from the bustling streets outside. Solid lunch or dinner spot.
author: Eshan I.

description: This is the best middle eastern food in the city. Best kept secret even though it's really easy to get to and park. The Shwarma is delicious. Hummus is amazing. And whatever you order - get a side of mujadara - it's something I've never had anywhere else and can't get enough.
author: Candy G.

description: Great food, relaxed ambiance. Go-to place for lunch in the area, but also works for dinner. Usually quick service. Alternative seating options at the back (floor cushions!) are fun.
author: Maulik S.

description:
The best thing about this place was that we walked in around 2:45pm, well after lunch hours, and the owner welcomed us in with open hours. We were practically the only ones in there. 
The shawarma platter was phenomenal, and so were the dolmas.
Hummus was decent - I've had better, but the combo with everything else made the whole meal absolutely delicious
author: Nabeel N.

description: I work across the street but I'd drive across town for their shawarma wrap. The service is always super friendly and the wrap never, ever disappoints.
author: Claire H.

description:
I don't usually write reviews but I really think this place deserves one. I've been here twice and both times the food was delicious! I live nearby and have only discovered the place last week. The place is a hidden gem and the price is very good too. I got the lamb shawarma the first time and also had the beef kebab (both are amazing). The hummus had really good texture too... 

Another thing I feel deserves mentioning is the design of the interior. It gives a really warm and welcoming feeling, the owner really did a good job with it.

I really recommend it, especially if you love Mediterranean food like I do. I'll definitely be coming back!
author: Parmis T.

description: I love this Mediterranean place near my office. I always get the lamb kebab plate and the mint lemonade. The lamb is amazing, as are the humus, bread, and other sides. Some of the sides change from time to time and it's always great to get to try something I've never had before.
author: Brian B.

description: Great go-to in the neighborhood for gyros, falafels, and apps. It's not for everyone, but if you like beets, do try the walnut beetroot dip. I was turned on to this place by my parents, as they've been going at least once a week for 5+ years.
author: J F.

description: I've been coming to Saffron 685 for many years. My favorites are usually the Falafel sandwich or lamb shawarma. I enjoy coming back here because of the great food and the welcoming owner and staff. One of the best Mediterranean restaurants in SOMA!!
author: Roger M.

description:
3.5 would be better for the value

a decent Mediterranean place in that weird SoMa neighborhood around 8th and Townsend. There's really nothing much in that area, probably because Zynga and Adobe are right there and they have free food for everyone :)

but I think this is a great value. the food is probably prepared in advance because it comes out immediately when you order. you order at the counter and they bring it to you. but wraps and hummus taste fresh and for around $10 you get plenty of food. we had some baba ganoush which was very good

so if you're in this neighborhood, hungry and without access to the Zynga cafeteria, this is a good choice
author: Bob U.

description:
The food was quite tasty but the portion size for the lamb was kind of sparse. Excellent falafel balls. Fast delivery time.

Would consider ordering again.
author: Jordan C.

description: Wonderful food with warm ambiance! I always stop by here when i come by the area to eat and craving for something unique and different. I 100% recommend this place
author: Kevin G.

description: This Mediterranean restaurant is one I visit at least once a week for lunch. A few of my favorites here are the falafel (appetizer or sandwich), fatoush salad, and the shawerma wrap. The best way I can describe the flavor of the food is that it is fresh, well seasoned, and you feel energized after your meal. This review is long overdue as I've been eating here for 3-4 years now! If you are craving a fresh healthy meal, or a restaurant to sit down and enjoy a laid back experience, give Saffron a visit!
author: Johnny K.

description: Come here for the delicious baba ghanoush and the pomegranate spritzer. Have eaten in and got take out. Nice staff, casual place. Love the food!
author: Alex B.

description: Food was great l highly recommend the place, the have many vegetarian and vegan options, the dips and appetizers excel in this place and the love the fresh Juices. Highly on my list.
author: Prathueang S.

description: Simple, clean, and comfortable. The food was good and without a long wait. The employee was very curteous and welcoming, answered our questions, and made the time spent there all the better.
author: Sobhana F.

description:
I have been coming to this restaurant for almost a year; since my office moved across the street. I have had many of the items on the menu and I am never disappointed. I love the chicken Kebab plate, my ultimate favorite. The chicken is perfectly seasoned and the rice is grainy and fluffy. I usually get the bean salad with it. I find the combination of flavors light very pleasing. 


I come to Saffron twice a week, some times more. I can simply sit down in the cozy area near the back with all the couches and have a beer. In this place I  am known and the service I receive is like I was walking into my family member's own house. 

When I want to get away from my office for an hour I go to Saffron and enjoy the awesome tunes always playing. 

I highly recommend it for a group of people or by yourself.  This is truly Mediterranean cuisine at its best. 

Love it! See you there - K
author: Dila J.

description: Excellent food and uncrowded. Every guest I've brought here has raved about it and wants to come back.  The dips are unique and fabulous, not found at other middle eastern places, and the Turkish, Syrian, and Lebanese deserts have many fans among my family members.  The homemade lemonade also got rave reviews among my husband and nieces.
author: Kelly L.

description: Food was wonderful so was the service, with a smile, priced reasonable, highly on my list for Turkish food.
author: Jose D.

description: Food always great the shawarma was divine, they make juice in the house, lemonade was my favorite, goes pretty well with most dishes, service was nice and with smile, l will be back when l'm in town. That's for sure.
author: Ahmed A.

description: The food was great, the lamb kebab plate was well tender and nicely maintained, have it with the fresh squeezed mint lemonade, a win win & prices pretty reasonable for San Francisco Bay Area
author: David S.

description: My goto place for office lunch. Love their shawarma plates - the gyro meat is just perfect. I've tried a lot of places here in San Francisco but this place always stands above the rest. The owner is also really nice and pleasant and always knows my order beforehand. Must try!!!
author: Mansi N.

description: I don't usually write reviews but this time l will make an exception since the food at this place was wonderful, it is quality healthy food, we sat on the low table, Moroccan type low table in the back, delicious options and service was friendly. I will back.
author: Albina T.

description: Love their food. Great chicken kebab plate also amazing lentil plate. The portions are very good. Friendly staff and most importantly very clean. Great place would definitely recommend it !!!
author: Meray D.

description: This place has yummy Mediterranean food. A must try!!! The lamb kebab plate is to die for.
author: deepti g.

description: Love this place.  Very authentic and delicious.  Get the shawarma, you won't regret it.
author: Sarah S.

description: My favorite casual go to dinner spot when I'm looking for something delicious and quick. I usually come after my evening workout and there's no wait and the food is served promptly. They've got fantastic Carrot Dip, Lamb Shawarma and handmade Turkish Delights to top the experience off! Love the local small business feel and seeing the owner who recognizes me each time too.
author: Jason L.

description: By far my favorite Mediterranean in the city. You can taste the quality and can tell the difference since the owner/chef definitely has a lot of love and passion for making great food for customers. He's very gracious, and friendly too. It's worth the wait here, always.
author: Jessica L.

description: I love this place , My favorite food. Good price. Have delicious dessert. Very suitable for lunch here.
author: Rich H.

description: This place is a bit of a hidden gem. I went here to grab a quick bite to eat and it was delicious, well priced, and the owner has wonderful taste in music. I'll definitely be back!
author: Emm H.

description: Wonderful food shawarma is high on my list tender and lean, prices pretty reasonable for San Francisco, they have fresh squeezed lemonade, very refreshing and they make pomegranate spritzer but my favorite the lemonade juice, if l could have a gallon l would not hesitate.
author: Patrick M.

description: I got the Mediterranean plate to go and it was incredibly tasty -- fresh and flavorful. I will definitely be back, as there were lots of things on the menu that were tempting.
author: Joelle J.

description: Food always great with reasonable prices for San Francisco, we've been coming to this place for more than 12 years, it has been always consistent solid food, the kebabs plated and the apps are top on my list.
author: Victor V.

description: Stopped in for an impromptu lunch. Ordered the meze plate and lamb sandwich. the pomegranate roasted pepper Walnut dip was really yummy and interesting the baba ganoush and Falafel were good. The lamb sandwich really exceeded our expectations, better than Oren's! Oren's still has the best pita though. Recommend!
author: Peter B.

description: Excellent falafel, baba ganoush and delicious fries with aioli. I came back a week later for more and I live in the East Bay! So happy to have a great falafel place in the area. The falafel balls were very fresh and tasty -as too few places have (I spent many years in NYC and love falafel). I'll be back again soon.
author: Julie C.

description:
I love the mix of "salads" they make. For $11 I eat a tasty good quality salad. My brother tried the shawarma -he didn't like it too much-, but seriously my plate was awesome! I came for 2nd time and still awesome. I dont know if they have it on the menu -they guy offered me this one-, but ask for it!
It basically has tabbouleh, fattoush, kind of mujadara (but good), and hummus.
The service was good, the place is ok.
author: Nermal B.

description: Amazing!! I love coming here. As a vegetarian there are so many options - the benefit of a Mediterranean place. I love the ambiance and decor which make it feel cozy and beautiful. It's great for a quick bite however, as the food is always ready very quickly! The people who work there have always been pleasant and talked to me about the food and answered any questions I had about it!! If you are craving Mediterranean come here!! Very authentic and delicious.
author: August R.

description: I'm getting hungry just thinking about writing this. Why...? 1) Med is one of my favorite cuisines (if not the favorite). 2) Saffron is legit. 3) It's also super clean which I love and finding clean med food can be hard to find. Like everything in life, you get what you pay for. Higher quality naturally means higher price. The food is great and paying $20 for a solid meal is well worth it to me. Sure you can get greasy med for less other places... if that's what your looking for. I prefer amazing food I feel good eating. Speaking of, the roasted red pepper dip is fantastic. And that hot sauce... so good. I swing by here every chance I get and can't wait for the next time! Oh... don't forget about the dessert!!
author: Andrew E.

description: I love this place. I live locally to this place, and it is a great stop for a casual meal, but with a very appealing ambience and decor. The cuisine is delicious- always fresh and consistent. The mediterranean diet is probably the healthiest cuisine you can eat, and while this is possibly underpriced for the quality...I'm not complaining!
author: Jackie B.

description: The food & service at Saffron 685 is great. Both my husband & I have been coming here for years and love the food. We live in the neighborhood and come here for the tabouleh and kebabs. The food is always served hot and fresh- also very quick!
author: Marzi W.

description: This my favorite place to go for a lunch! The food is  sooooo delicious, my absolutely favorite one is plate with beef or chicken. They marinated it and than grill it. I know the owner for a while, so I know where the food is coming from. The service is fast which is great for a short lunch time. Oh... and absolutely delicious desert i ever had - Konafa!!! the desert die for!
author: Dana S.

description: I taste quality in the food. Wraps are a favorite. And konafa is an absolute favorite. Recommend dine in for the music and ambience that complement your taste buds. Personalized treatment from the hospitable staff.
author: Dhanush M.

description:
Best chicken shawarma ever !! 
Tasty food , prompt service and very nice people :)
Must try the baklava for dessert !!
author: Rayen B.

description: Really amazing food and great service, highly reccommend the balsamic aioli and the lamb kebab plate, amazing platters!!
author: Liz A.

description: What a treat! I took a group for lunch here after a volunteer event and we had a blast. The food was very fresh, delicately spiced with generous servings, you could tell they use good ingredients, the menu suited a broad range of taste preferences, dietary styles. The service was quite quick. The wait staff were friendly and helpful - one of our group had a disability that needed special accommodation that was graciously taken care of without asking. There were cushy pillows on the end lining the wall, , music add to the ambience. We had such a good time that we sat and chatted after the meal without feeling hustled to leave. Definitely worthy of many repeat visits. My only regret was not sampling the desserts.
author: Roza S.

description: I've been eating lunch here for years and the food is consistently great. The lamb shwerma is amazing and the home-made sweets are dangerously good.
author: Danny H.

description: Great for a quick grab on the go. Services fast and the wraps are good. Don't skip out on the baklava!
author: Trevor H.

description:
I decided to write another review on Saffron 685. I've been eating here for 7+ years and I love it. They have an extensive menu, most of which I have tried. The food is always fresh and tasty! And it is inexpensive. A win, win, win!

I've been for casual sit-down dinners in their cozy dining area or take-away falafel wraps...I recommend either :)
author: Rob F.

description:
Complete miss. Chicken wrap was a poor imitation of a chicken shawarma. Drowning in hummus and some kind of bland sauce, the wrap disintegrated within moments. Full of grilled vegetables haphazardly stuffed into a thin piece of flatbread. 

Overpriced at $9.50 for all of six pieces of chicken in the wrap. Avoid.
author: Anthony N.

description: My first review, came here for a dinner last night with a couple of friends, server was nice and patient enough answering all question, food wise, a quality fresh ingredient food stands out when comparing to other Turkish Mediterranean eateries in San Francisco. The pomegranate spritzer made in the house and was wonderful.
author: Karyna D.

description:
Super rude guy behind the counter (the cook i believe), dumps our order at a distant table expecting us to go pick our food (WEIRD!). Pretty looking lady at the counter cannot understand what we want to order, everything had to be repeated like 5 times, and the rude cook guy is belching out some wise cracks from behind her.

Super expensive average food with limited portions and drab looking interiors, not worth the three and half stars. Will never make the mistake of going here again. (Is there an option for less than a single star?)
author: V M.

description: I've been to Saffron at least 4-5 times. The shawarma wrap is highly recommended: the tenderness of the meat is outstanding. Overall excellent place for casual dining.
author: Rob W.

description: We love this restaurant! The food is delicious and prepared quickly. The cook is wonderful and very accommodating. My daughter has several food allergies, so restaurants can be difficult, but at Saffron 685, we never have to worry. We eat in or get take-out regularly. You won't be disappointed.
author: Yuki I.

description: This review is long overdue -- just over 7 years late. Whoops! This is my go to spot for Mediterranean food, and boy, come to think of it, Saffron was the place where I started my addiction to the cuisine. I've had their falafel and chicken wraps, and falafel plate, and it is delicious and amazing. The falafel isn't too dry and salty in my mouth. The restaurant itself is very clean, and has a nice ambience. The owner/chef is very passionate with the food he makes and always make sure the plate he serves have a clean presentation, like going to a high end restaurant. Overall, I'd highly recommend Saffron with the high quality of their food and the clean spacious restaurant. Can't wait to go back and grab another wrap when I'm around the area!
author: Anna Z.

description: Wonderful dinner, service likewise, the server answered all our questions and recommended some of the dips which were great, the meat selections dishes were tender & nicely falaverod, highly on my list.
author: Hamidou D.

description: I had the beef wrap. It was very delicious. My friend had the chicken kabob which she said was tasty.
author: Michelle L.

description:
I go to Saffron 685 just about every Friday Night or Saturday Evening, for dinner, after I go Grocery Shopping in the area.

The food is great, great prices, and Ziad always waits on me.

The man is amazing, he cooks, serves, and cleans, and still has time to be cordial.

Because it is late in the afternoon, he is always working alone, and keeps up with
the In-House Clientele, as well as the Phone Orders.. I don't know how he does it.

I love Greek-Middle Eastern Food, and Saffron 685 is the best!

Jerry W.
author: Jerry W.

description: I was meaning to try this place as I live one block away. I tried it today. I bought a Shawerma Wrap to go for $10.85. The attendant took 1 or 2 minutes to have it ready. I thought "that was quick". Well it was quick because he did not even bother to heat it. As it was handed to me, it did not feel warm. When I got it home, I bit into it, the meat was cold and the bread was not even toasted. It was like biting into soggy bread. Gross. If this was the level of attention to detail at this restaurant, I will not be dining there. First time and last time.
author: Carlos E.

description:
(Upped to 2 stars since he took the time and care to respond to my original review)
The food was good, but the 1 star rating is not a mistake. Having good food is not enough. You need customer service, and I mean average people skills here. I've seen better customer service at McDonald's at 3am than during prime lunch hours here.

We walked in, nobody welcomed us. We were sitting at the table for 5 minutes before we decided that we may have to order at the counter. The man (owner/manager) was rude anytime on multiple occasions, and there was simply no reason for it.

A coworker of mine echoed the same sentiment about this place. He experienced rude service for no reason. 

Very off-putting. Maybe worth it for take-out only, but I even still I won't be back because I'm too proud/stubborn. There are enough of other places in this city, just go somewhere else.
author: Nick S.

description: Worst customer service ever. Guy with the red hat is so rude! I will never eat here again. We ordered our food to dine in, they gave us a number for our table, but we still had to get up and pick up our plates from the counter. Why give us a number of the server doesn't bring us our food!?! Total assholes. Never again
author: Karen F.

description: Been going there for 6 years very regularly for lunch. Their falafel is nice and juicy, hummus is yummy and their kanafa is heavenly. Chicken kebabs are very good as well. All in all, a good, fast Mediterranean joint
author: Kelash K.

description: The food is fresh and delicious! We often order take out during the week and pick up - easy parking - on the way home up the (Potrero) Hill. The salmon is always delicious and cooked just right. All of the veg and grain sides and dips we've had have been super - tabouleh, hummus, carrot dip and spicy green pepper dip (our favorite!!). Healthy, fresh and made quickly to order. And the manager/chef is a delightful, welcoming guy. Happy to have this tasty and dependable "go-to" in our neighborhood.
author: Sydney P.

description:
Great spot for delicious, fresh, flavorful Mediterranean food. I've been coming here for years now and have found the food quality to be consistent and service friendly.
I love the lamb and chicken kabob plates, and my husband likes the veggie mezze plate. And the baklava is so yummy!
author: Tracy F.

description: Excellent spot to come by for lunch, a favorite among my colleagues and myself. From people to food - this place is great; I've tried the shawarma wrap, beef kebab plate, humus - all are delicious and authentic, wish I had time to stop by more often. The chefs are expedient, the food is fresh, and the venue is not large - but super comfortable; can easily accommodate a group of 5 or 6, and has a generally pleasant, relaxing vibe. Great place to bring guests - it leaves a very nice impression. Looking forward to the next time I visit!
author: Tim U.

description:
I've been coming to this establishment since moving to this neighborhood a few years ago.

The kebabs are tender and juicy and the different vegetarian dishes are excellent. The shawarma is my favorite.

Service is generally attentive and the atmosphere pleasant, prices are affordable and very reasonable for SOMA. Definitely one of my favorite  restaurants in the city.
author: Siddhaarth V.

description: I work in the area and as a vegan, my restaurant options are limited.  I love middle eastern food and I'm happy to have this option just 2 blocks away. They have a lot of options and have always been very accommodating.  It is also well priced.
author: Cordelia s.

description:
UPDATE:  The crazy owner/manager offers me a free meal via nessage and when I ignore his offer, he accuses me of being a delivery person who is not allowed to use his restrooms!  LOL 

ordered for pick up the other night and found the food to be decent, however the manager/owner working was just plain rude and cold blooded!
