I came in to pick up my order and I politely asked if I could use the restroom (and this is after I had paid for my food)  I am told that the plumbing in the bathroom(s) is not working and he walks away.......I notice a man coming out from the back area OBVIOUSLY from the working bathroom.  SERIOUSLY?
author: John C.

description: My husband and I come here every couple of weeks. The lamb shawarma is amazing as is the salmon plate. The owner is super nice and attentive. A really nice place for a delicious meal!
author: Achal D.

description: I work around the corner.  Saffron is my go to lunch joint - a diamond in the rough in this part of town.  I recommend the Meza plate with baba ganoush, dolma, and bean salad.
author: Brice L.

description:
Solid food. The chicken kebabs were tender and there were 6 pieces of chicken. The tzatziki was fresh but the lavash was a bit dry every time I got it. Lamb was cooked well. The sides varied- the lamb came with the carrot dip and hummus and the chicken came with the bean salad and hummus.
The fries were my favorite part of the meal- they are freshly made like mom used to make- hand cut (all irregularly shaped), fried and have that greasy not so crispy texture you get when you make fries at home... And the aiolis are nice.
author: Piper W.

description: Lovely delightful place, as l've been coming for years to this establishment, got to say it is quality quality quality food, always fresh and prices soooo reasonable for soma area in San Francisco, try the meza entree pretty delicious and you get to choose if any 3 appetizers.
author: Asso E.

description:
Food is absolutely delicious! I had the chicken kebab plate which came with hummus pita and salad. Food is definitely 4 stars however price is pretty expensive I spent a little over $18 on lunch pretty pricey if you ask me and especially when there really wasn't a lot of chicken on the kebabs but taste was on point! 

The reason I am only giving 3 stars is because the place was pretty dead and it was awkward to order no one really greeted me I kinda shuffled around the counter finally asking to order something then I sat down at a table and waited for my food. The guy wasn't rude or anything but not very friendly either I honestly felt so awkward sitting there eating by myself and was wishing I took the food to go.
author: Sabrina W.

description: We had the chicken plate and the beef steak, the baklavas are made in the house Both were good, all in all food was fantastic so was the service. Highly recommended
author: Mohammed A.

description: Food is delicious, but bring your own hot sauce! They don't keep any on hand and look at you like you're crazy when you ask for some.
author: Scot H.

description:
Been meaning to write a review for a while, but kept forgetting to do so.

Close to work, great place to go to for lunch or dinner for Mediterranean;  I especially like the Fire Spicy Green Pepper Dip / Pita, and the Lamb Kebab Plate.  I also like the Moroccan Hot Mint Tea.

It's nice to be able to make a meal out of just appetizers or go whole sheep when you're hungry  (^_^).

Staff and owner are always friendly, so it's always a nice stop!
author: ninpou k.

description:
I have been to Saffron Restaurant many times. Every time I go, I try a different dish and they all are delicious and authentic. Prawn kebab my favorite, it is unique and spectacular.
The staff are very welcoming and warm. Great atmosphere. Quaint and cozy. Great food, great place, :)
author: Jayr R.

description:
This is my favorite place in the city for Mediterranean food. My wife and I have been coming here for the last five years and we love it the food is excellent it's fresh and innovative. We just had saffron 685 cater a party for us and all of my guests were wowed by the food. 

My personal favorites are the lamb kebab plate and french fries with a lemon Saffron Aoli!! The hummus is excellent and all of the dips are also very very tasty. I love bringing my veggie/vegan friends because the falafel is always a big hit. This place is a gem!! Thank you saffron 685!!!!!
author: Sampeter O.

description: I always get the mediterranean plate and it's very tasty. It's very close to my work so I usually order pick up. The employees are always nice and they prepare the food quickly.
author: Natalie H.

description:
Pros:  family owned
Cons: tiny portions, slow

With just a bit of focus on speeding things up at the register and adding value, would have been great.
author: Henry B.

description:
Meh. Some friends and I ended up here on a Saturday night to celebrate a birthday .. not clear why we chose the place but whatever we were there and we were literally the only people there that night. Which is not surprising given that it's a Saturday and no one is working in SOMA that day--funny story when we left, we learned from our Uber driver that this was the only area without any surge pricing. anyways.. I digress

The service here was pretty subpar. We were a party of 10+ so perhaps we were too hectic or something to deal with? It took forever for someone to take our order and then only mid meal did they decide to offer us any water... and that entire process was such a fiasco. I guess to be fair there were only 2-3 employees there that night ... and 2-3 tables filled ... but okay whatever. Like I said it was a very mediocre experience.  

Food itself was decent but nothing amazing. We got the hummus plates, lamb skewers, chicken skewers... jesus we ordered a million things but the fact that I can barely remember what I was eating is a testament to how mediocre I found the experience to be. I could see how this place might be better for a quick grab and go lunch kind of affair but if you try to sit down and have a relatively nicer dinner, it definitely backfires very quickly

tldr; the food is a solid 3, the service is pretty bad though if you try to dine-in....price though is the bomb dot com lol literally spent $11/person even though we ordered 10 or so plates which was ridiculous
author: Jasmine X.

description:
I used to live above this place 8 years ago. And ever since I left I've craved its delicious food.
Thankfully, I was able to visit a few weeks ago and I can happily report that it remains of the same excellent quality as always.

Back then, as a newcomer to San Francisco, it was an amazing introduction to Mediterranean food and through the months I eagerly unraveled the flavors of all the delicious dishes that Ziad's cooking presented: hummus, tabbouleh, soft yet crunchy falafels all in perfect harmony contrasting and complimenting what became my favorite dish at this place: the shawarma plate.

Time went by and I moved away to the other side of the world to another foodie city (Sydney) and since then I've had the chance to try lots and lots of different foods, from the fancy to the street, and many mediterranean places which abound over here, but that perfect balance of flavors I've only been able to find at this little establishment on Townsend St.

When you visit don't forget to round up the meal with a Baklava.
author: Daniel S.

description: The food was excellent, fresh, and the customer service was amazing. I highly recommend this authentic Turkish restaurant that is in the SOMA district of San Francisco. Their prices are also reasonable. I am definitely going back
author: Alice D.

description: Saffron 685 is not only great for every day eats, it's a fantastic source for catering for clients. Their Mediterranean platter is the biggest hit at everyone of my events. The staff is helpful and always makes sure everything is fresh, delicious and perfectly presented. They definitely have a loyal customer!
author: Laura B.

description: This restaurant is near my work, so it's a convenient place to go to for lunch. It's a small-ish place with a cozy Mediterranean environment. I've been here a few times already, and the food is good, albeit perhaps a bit pricey for what you get. I'm a fan of the shawarma plate since you basically get a taste of everything. On a cold day, the spicy hot chocolate is a nice way to finish off :) The service is friendly sometimes, but inconsistent. Also, it's probably not a place to go for a quick lunch - but definitely a nice environment if you have the time to stay and chill for a while.
author: Bianca C.

description: Best Lamb Shwarma in San Francisco!  I've been getting takeout from here twice a month for the past 4 years.  It's my favorite Lamb Shwarma in the city, and my wife swears by their Lamba Kebabs.  It puzzles me as to why the restaurant isn't packed with a line out the door every evening.
author: Vijay P.

description: If you enjoy eating human excrement, by all means order from this fine, clean and gracious establishment.
author: Andrew J.

description: I love their Shawerma Wrap and Moroccan Carrot Dip.  I've been coming here almost weekly for a few years and have never been disappointed.
author: Joshua H.

description: Excellent food and even better service!  Would highly recommend to anyone that wants fresh authentic Mediterranean cuisine.
author: Jennel M.

description: Best Mediterranean food in San Francisco. Dishes are fresh and the hummus is incredible!  This is your place for your favorite Shawerma plate or wrap.  Baklava is quite a tasty way to finish.  If you are at airbnb or zynga you have got to check this place out for lunch or dinner...right around the corner! Great music and perfect lighting.
author: Ann F.

description: food was good l recommend you order difffernt appetizers, tapas type so you get the chance to try differnt dips, don't miss on the organic carrot dip & the organic beets, both are good, prices are resonable for san francisco, highly recomended.
author: Jonnathan D.

description: I ordered a chicken shawarma wrap here and it was mostly potato :/ not sure I've even ever heard of potato in a shawarma anyway but it certainly should be less than the amount of chicken.  They also charge extra for hot sauce....feels like they are just nickel and dimming. Sub par :/
author: Jessica J.

description:
One of the worst dishes I ever had. I ordered a Hummus plate and even if I would've tried, it wouldn't have come out as bad as I got it. The texture was horrible, no tahini was added and if I was blind folded I would never know it was Hummus.
TL;DR - Disappointment.
author: Roi A.

description: The customer service is really bad!!! The guy who took my order at the counter here doesn't know how to talk to the customer! Also the food wasn't good. I ordered shawarma salad and the lamb was super salty. Will never be coming back here.
author: Supriya G.

description: I love coming here on my lunch. This is the best restaurant in the area. You can tell that the chef put a lot of effort in the quality of his work. Not only that the food is delicious, this restaurant has great ambience and is very well maintained. I can easily rate this restaurant as the best Mediterranean restaurant in town. If you want to try Mediterranean food for the first time, you won't be disappointed at saffron 685.
author: Issam K.

description:
I have been coming to Saffron 685 for many years, since i've worked in the area, on and off.  I enjoy Mediterranean food and this place hits a sweet spot for me with their wraps, kebobs, hummus and the delicious pita bread. 

I also enjoy the Mint Lemonade very much. 

The staff is casual, friendly and always helpful.   

I highly recommend Saffron 685 as a fun lunch spot or a relaxing dinner spot.
author: Quynh N.

description:
Worst experience ever. The food quality and guys attitude was so bad that it ruined my whole weekend. The owner/server first wanted us to sit on the corner table right next to the door coz we had a kid with us. Then, we felt like he wanted us to leave asap so he served us partially cooked gyro and kababs. Even the fries were not fully cooked. They tasted really bad. He didn't even bother to serve us water.

Another family with two kids showed up when we were there and the server asked them to sit again on a corner table near the door. The politely asked the owner if they could sit on some other table but his reply was that you can only sit on this table as you have kids and rest of restaurant isn't kids friendly. There were around 15 open tables at that time and we were the only one eating there.

I'm extremely surprised with the other reviewers giving it 5 stars as that encourage us to go there in the first place. I wonder if these are his friends. Extremely rude guy and pathetic food. I'd never go there again.
author: Arif I.

description: Just came in already dissatisfied with the customer service.  Hope, lamb kebab going to be good, if not I will be very mad too since I been fasting all day. I am not looking for the best service but at least be kind to who ever walks in to your restaurant's doors. Definetaly not going to come back regardless of how good the food will be.
author: Fin B.

description: the pomgranete peper dip really good my favorite, also tge green fire spicy dip is nice, lomonade fresh sqeezed juice refreshing, all in all l love this placd . konafa dessert with honey and orange blossom riccotta mozarella. was great too.
author: Jabrane B.

description: GREAT FLAVORFUL AFFORDABLE FOOD. Quick service, great vibe, uniquely delicious food. Come here!
author: Cassie P.

description: Great place for casual Mediterranean food. Do not miss out on the delicious mint lemonade. A truly unique flavor.
author: Jake S.

description: It's one of my favorites spots in the city for Turkish cuisine. I've been going here for many years and the food and service is consistently great. They have a great menu and some of my favorite dishes includes the shawarma wrap, the kebab plate and the falafel plate.  I would recommend this place to anyone.
author: Conetha V.

description: I've been coming to this Turkish establishment for almost 10 years, I will rate it 5 starts mostly for the food. The Wild caught grilled Salmon done to perfection and was oh so fresh! I would recommend it to any seafood fan out there! My husband had the rotisserie lamb steak and  admitted it to be the best he has ever had. We ended up dinner with hot Turkish tea with Cardamom, service was friendly & fast.
author: Lana A.

description: Definitely one of the better Mediterranean food places in SoMa/FiDi. Their shawerma wrap is absolutely delicious!
author: Anu R.

description: I work near by and love to grab a healthy, delicious lunch here! My go-to's are the fattoush salad, lentil soup and/or the falafel plate. Kind service, good atmosphere. They have happy hour too, which is a plus for us that work in the area!
author: Madeleine M.

description: Was excited for a lamb shawarma to go. Just after paying, I saw the female cashier touch some other customer's food (pita bread) without washing her hands. Being in the restaurant business, I am concerned when I see this, and it calls into question what other responsible food practices aren't being followed. When I received the shawarma I was not that happy with its consistency. More importantly, after a few bites, I realized the meat was not hot, with some of it only at room temperature. Having had food poisoning from a shawarma before (actually I hadn't had one since that episode many years ago), I couldn't ignore what I consider a huge red flag. I decided it wasn't worth the risk & threw it out. Needless to say I won't be going back.
author: Paul R.

description:
Was looking for alternatives to the company cafeteria and tried Saffron 685 down the street. Cool decor with some low tables & pillows along with more standard seating. Mediterranean menu with prices from $7 (falafel wrap) to $16.50 (salmon plate) for the main dishes. I went with my typical Lamb shawerma ($8.25) and side of falafel ($2.75)

Falafel was greasy. Sprinkle of sumac onions & parsley and container of tahini + chopped tomato & cucumber (http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/TcUhtqRLL-lwSGJmpz415Q?select=FyKTQ3l1at4mzyJjRPaQxw#FyKTQ3l1at4mzyJjRPaQxw). Lots of sesame seeds dominated the flavor. Would have preferred straight tahini to dip into; the mix with chopped veggies made it awkward to eat.

On to the lamb shawerma wrap. I saw the vertical rotisserie had ground meat in a pre-formed cone vs. fresh layers of thin strips of meat. Fries, tomato, cucumber, tahini, and nice housemade hot sauce (http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/TcUhtqRLL-lwSGJmpz415Q?select=0ZGio01O5PVE8uwocuz4QQ#0ZGio01O5PVE8uwocuz4QQ). Decent flavors, but poorly constructed and was falling apart almost immediately so I needed to proceed with a plate, knife & fork.

Falafel: 2.5 stars
Lamb Shawerma wrap: 3.5 stars
author: Andrew C.

description: This new review is not for the food but for the people at Saffron. The manager Ziad contacted me after my review to apologize and offer another meal or a reimbursement. I will not take it but appreciate the gesture and I believe that good service matters.
author: Coralie S.

description:
Just Love this Place .. Amazing 
Being working in the neighborhood for years this will be my place when it comes to vegetarian foods, the lentil cracked wheat & tabouleh will be my first choices, tabouleh as some reviews said here is one of the best you could get. Dips(carrot dip, beetroot) are also awesome
Waitstaff always friendly and welcoming.
author: Sonam J.

description:
Probably one of the best Mediterranean Turkish food you can get in San Francisco, simple food with unique spin.

Being regular I have tried each item on their menu and literally there isn't a single one to avoid! Strongly recommended!
author: sean h.

description:
I order from Saffron 685 at least once a week!  Love the salmon filet plate and chicken kebab plate.  Bean salad and hummus = delicious!! 

Great "to-go" presentation.

The staff is the best, always helpful, energetic and kind!!
author: Amanda G.

description: I ordered a salad for lunch. It came out in a small bowl with no dressing on it. I asked for some sauce and they guy asked me for $1. He then lifts up the bowl and says dressing is in the bottom (there is none). Very rude and bad customer service. I do not recommend.
author: MisterSF N.

description:
I love Saffron 685! They are literally my "go-to" lunch spot for my Execs. I feel like I use them so much that I play it out but low and behold my guys never get tired of it - it's always a treat for the team when I order from them! 

I usually order the Salmon plate or the chicken plate. Both are awesome, salmon is more healthy since it's over salad vs. rice. 

They're also really nice and super accommodating and fast. We sometime order 15 lunches (day-of) and they are on it! Clearly... you know I'm going back! :)
author: Christine L.

description: Food was OK. But Im going back and buying a ton of their sesame cookies for home. Just delicious!
author: Ashutosh T.

description: Quality and Qty are great. Spices and seasonings are in point. Service was at first shaky but overall good. Lamb plate was awesome and shawarma wrap was very tasty; nice bite of potato. Overall, we really did like this place and will come back again.
author: megan a.

description:
I cannot believe this person is the owner this is what he comments 

This lady came asking for a change on a Saturday afternoon the server said sorry we don't have change, the next day or two we got this review. 

this is the most disgusting comment I have ever read. I came in after my mani/pedi almost dark outside... hungry...and no I never needed change...your food was disgusting...sorry you can't handle a real review
author: Dee D.

description: The place looks empty with uncomfortable seats as you walk past, although it opens up inside, with leather sofas and a much nicer decor inside.  The food was excellent, I had the falafel appetizer and beef kebab plate. The falafel was both crispy and flavorsome.  The beef was excellent with a nice charred finish and lovely taste. My friend had the lamb kebab plate, which he was extremely pleased with, except for one piece of lamb that was mostly gristle - hence 4 stars instead of 5.
author: Richard S.

description:
I tried to give this place a second chance because it's so close to my work and other yelp reviews seem to only rave, but it is beyond mediocre and ridiculously overpriced for the quality.

In full honesty, I've only ordered pick up for lunch, so it might be better dining in or at dinner, but the two times I've done it, food was cold and not that appetizing, service was lackluster, and the price was astronomical. You do get a lot of food, but $16 for a schawerma plate that tastes worse than what I get from a street cart is just ridiculous. The most recent time, they forgot part of my order and they weren't apologetic when I called and accused me of never ordering the missing items. Since I was ordering for a staff lunch, it was very embarrassing that they couldn't get my order right and that the restaurant tried to blame me for the snafu. Would not suggest for work events as their food apparently cools instantly and they are not willing to assist you when they get your order wrong. EDIT! Management was very upset that I said the food was cold. So let me rephrase, I guess it is served piping hot and then cools within the 10 minutes it takes me to get back to the office. Food cools very quickly :)

In terms of food, the only thing I liked here were the fries and baklava and everything else was below average. (They change up the sides a lot which means it's a crap-shoot if you'll get something you like or not). EDIT!: While they do switch up the sides, apparently you can request different salad sides to your plate. 

EDIT! Due to the cattiness of the management, I will not be back, especially because I am apparently banned from them now for being unhappy LOL. But I'm sure if you don't cross them or if you don't care about service, you'll have an ok time here. God forbid if they forget something in your order and you complain about that though, because that apparently was all my fault and I am not welcome there anymore. Good thing I didn't want to come back :)
author: Christina R.

description: Great place and excellent food. Eat here all the time. The steak kabab with hummus and fattoush is the move. A hidden gem IMO.
author: Mickey M.

description: Went in for lunch with a friend and ordered the Falafel Wrap and the Lamb Kakob Plate.We shared and both were Delicious. The gentleman who took our order was the owner and steered us in the right direction. He was very informative, very nice and made us feel welcome. Highly recommend!!
author: Winona M.

description: I LOVE this place. The lamb shawarma salad is my favorite thing on the menu, but all the meat is really exceptional. They also have some amazing dips - spicy green pepper is my favorite, but you really can't go wrong with the appetizer option that includes 3 different dips/apps. Really adorable environment as well - cute and quiet enough to hear each other talk.
author: Kelly C.

description: great and easy for work lunch, staff has always been cool with me and accommodating. Showed up with a large group and they took it like champs. Plus the menu is reasonably priced. Get the swarma wrap .
author: Samir A.

description: Food was OK but pricy.  Falafel was bit dry.  Ambiance was nice. The owner was quite brusk, bordering on rude.
author: Brett N.

description: Great food, really friendly management, and a cozy atmosphere to kick back on a couch and enjoy your lunch break / any meal. I work across the street and come here every week - the falafel and other wraps are delicious, and the portions are generous. I highly recommend ordering a side of the Tahina paste with literally any meal, it's a top notch dipping sauce for all you sauce-aholics!
author: James P.

description: Always fresh l love the mint lemonade, it compliments many of the entrées, the beef steak is lovely, l mean you could get beef steak anywhere but the spices & the marinade they use gives it special taste, they have many dips & side dishes to choose from, the organic walnut beets tops them.
author: Kino A.

description:
I love this place. The staff are always very nice and pleasant. Once you come here couple times the owner will actually remember what you usually like which makes it a very personable experience. 
Some of the dishes I love and why:

1.Chicken kebabs plate: They always cooked just right 
2. Their home cut fries are extremely yummy and always served fresh. Also comes with their tomato creamy house sauce.
3. Lentil soup: very light and perfectly spiced
4. Mediterranean plate: If you like dips, falafel and grape leaves this is the perfect combo (great to share an app between 2 people)
5. And last but not least is their housemade dessert "Kenafa" ask the owner when they will have fresh in the week because it's not always available but so worht going there for.

And finally what I also love about Saffron it's quiet atmosphere in the afternoon. Very peaceful and you can get wifi from starbucks next door and do some work and browse the net for whatever you need while enjoying comfy seats and Zen atmosphere. It helps as well that they always play great chill music :)
I highly recommend going here.
author: Wydad M.

description:
I wish this place was good, I really do! I live in the apts above this spot and pass by all the time, so I finally decided to stop in last week to have lunch here with my half asleep toddler. After about 3 min of standing at the counter awkwardly and being the only soul in the place, I see the owner guy look at me but kept doing whatever he was doing in the back. I finally just left. Funny enough I always see him walking on the sidewalk to get his mail that's why I wanted to give him some business... 

The 2 stars come from the shawarma plate I shared with a friend 2 years ago while pregnant, but the service was horrible then... I didn't care I just wanted to eat whatever was in front of me and take a nap.
author: Alisha T.

description: Two of us had dinner there and found it extremely worth while. All of the dishes were well prepared. We would particularly recommend the antipasti platter which had a huge variety of excellent flavors and tid bits that all seemed to mesh very well. The waitstaff service was good and prices for what we got were good value. All in all highly recommended.
author: Elena K.

description:
This is my new favorite lunch spot. It's really close to my office and the food is amazing. As an added bonus they have 100 on their health report!

My favorite menu item is their fries served with saffron meyer lemon aioli. The fried are cut huge, fried fresh, and sprinkled with paprika. The aioli is out of this world delicious.
 
I have also had the vegetable lavash sandwich, the roasted veggie salad, and the meza plate with falafel, tabbouleh, and babganoush. 

Everything that I have tried has been great!
author: Stephanie T.

description: Love the Kebab plates and the wraps. The best tabbouleh salad and hummus I've ever had.
author: Deborah C.

description: Always great! Always a must for us when on this side of town. Everything tastes amazing, always fresh and the owner knows what he is dong and does it well!!!
author: Carlo D.

description:
We're regulars here at Saffron 685 and come for lunch or dinner. It's also safe to say we've had everything on the menu. Nothing disappoints. It's all super fresh.
The lentil soup is excellent, beef steak is favorable & succulent, konafa dessert from heaven, honestly, it's all really good.
author: Ana M.

description:
We were looking for a place on Townsend and Saffron was open on a Saturday so it fit our needs. Most places are not open in the area for lunch on A Saturday.  There are more people there at night and during the week.

The people were very nice and the service was excellent.  The place is painted with bright colored to denote the saffron color.

It's a casual looking place with cozier seating in the back.  It's clan and the food is very good.   I ordered my favorite dishes, the baba ganoush and the lamb over salad.  Everything is fresh and crisp.  I will go there again. 

I actually didn't look at all of the pictures in advance.
author: Christine U.

description: I always get a shawarma wrap and it's my favorite in SF. Been going here for over 2 years and they make it just right and the wrap is pretty big too.
author: Tom K.

description:
The food was so so.
There was something that happened with the bill that was kind of questionable. 
But it was after I received my credit card statement that I saw it.
And reading other reviews for this restaurant, it seems that it is normal for them to add charges or raise the bill a bit. 

I would just be careful when going here and check the bill and make sure that they are charging the correct amount.
author: Laura B.

description: The wraps are huge here!! I had a falafel wrap and my bf had the shawarma wrap, and I thought both were pretty good. I really liked how the falafel wrap had fresh veggies and fried eggplant, as well as how the shawarma wrap was super flavorful. Truly Mediterranean is better, but I would definitely come back whenever I'm in Soma.
author: Abby S.

description:
This place is awful. First of all, their food is overpriced and mediocre. A lamb wrap better have more than three pieces of lamb in it. 

Second of all, service is awful and ridiculously slow. It took a good 20 minutes of awkwardly waiting in silence to receive my to go order in an empty restaurant. No reassurance that my food would be right out or anything like that. 

Lastly, I got my food to go and did not tip on a $10 order including tax. So what the hell is extra dollar doing on my posted credit card charges, Saffron? I monitor my expenses like a hawk. Why the hell do you think you can add an extra dollar for a tip when you didn't deserve it? Disputing that crap right now, and I am not returning to your god awful restaurant.
author: Paulina D.

description: We arrived at 7 PM. Man at the counter just stared at his phone, did not acknowledge us until we said hello. We asked if they were open and he hesitated like we were a bother and said just for a half hour more. Yelp says they're open until 9 PM. Then he asked are you eating in or out, and we said in, and he reluctantly nodded his head. Finally we decided to leave saying to him "well, we won't bother you."  Let's all choose "not to bother him" as that's a strange way to run a customer service business.
author: Q E.

description: It was nice in the inside, but my chicken kebab plate to go ended up being a veggie/prawn plate for some reason and I don't like veggies :/. So I didn't enjoy, and I paid a lot of money for something I really, really don't like. I didn't notice until I was back at my hotel.
author: Zahara B.

description:
I remember this place back when it was called some other name, but that was well before Yelp even existed. 

Anyway, this is a fantastic place to come to for dinner with a large group. Since this place is located in a business district that means it is practically deserted at night. I've run into many problems with groups of 6+ in the city many times and it's nice to find little gems like this one.
author: Jennifer P.

description: Never going back.  We ordered food to go for our little afternoon lunch expecting a good meal but what we ended up with was a cold and tasteless  meal!  The pita was rubbery and stale.  I called the restaurant to complain and was told that I did not know good food when I got it!  Really?   Then hung up on!  Never again.
author: John C.

description: I've been coming here for about 4 yrs. Definitely the best food in the area and a nice quiet relaxing place for lunch or dinner.
author: Jonathan H.

description: Good food and good service. I highly recommend when you are in the area to drop. I highly recommend the seafood and can't beat their hummus.
author: Elizabeth W.

description: I come here for lunch a lot. I like the platter that allows you to mix and match 3 dishes.
author: Margaret R.

description:
reading some of these review, I must have been there on a bad day.

The food (shawarma plate) was terrible.  Other than the fact they were using the WRONG meat, the over all quality of the seasoning and presentation were totally off.

It was priced reasonability and the place itself is big and nicely setup, but that doesn't make for the bad food experience.

There are many different food options near the Design District.  I will try my luck at a mediterranean food elsewhere
author: Mike S.

description: Second time we've come here (we'd be frequent visitors if we lived closer, because we love the food).  They actually had closed, but stayed open to prepare our meals!  What great service!
author: Kunal S.

description:
This place has legit mom and pop style Turkish food. Having lived in NY and Michigan, I have gotten accustomed to always having accessible authentic middle eastern food. This place is my fav middle eastern place in SF so far. 
The fattush is light but well seasoned. Their falafel was flavorful but not over-fried. Tabbouleh was very fresh and just divine. My bf loves their lamb shawarma, which is crispy but tender and juicy at the same time. 
If you want good Turkish food, this is it!
author: Nancy Z.

description:
I discover this place when i moved in the apartments above it, and since then I've been here quite often. Every time I've been here the food has been great and fresh, it does take a bit of time to get it as this place has a small crew. But the food is worth the wait, their tabbouleh is really good and chunky, you can taste the ingredients. Their wraps do taste different from others out there and I think it's because they have potatoes in them, which adds a nice texture to the whole thing. They're still great and big enough to fill you up. Ask for their mint lemonade to wash it down. Their party plates are great for parties, I've used them in my last three and my guests are always asking where I got the awesome food. 
I give them four stars because, though they're pretty good, to me the best falafel and shawarma place still is Mammouns in the West Village in NYC.
author: Willy L.

description:
I crave their tabbouleh!!!!

Initially I started coming here because they were convenient to my office, however after moving down to Los Angeles and only coming back up every couple weeks I find myself seriously missing this place.  While there are a lot of good places in LA, nothing compares to the fresh, bright and well balanced fattoush of this place.

They also have things that you don't see at the big chain places such as za'atar (an awesome spice which is delicious and should be adopted by more Americans immediately).

I typically take my food to go, settle in at my desk and allow the creaminess of the hummus to take away some of the stress caused by piling up emails.
author: Jenna G.

description: Very good food!!! I had the veggie wrap and my husband had the lamb kebab plate. We shared the french fries. I agree with the other reviews regarding service. The employees are not rude but not friendly. The man at the counter was wearing a hat and looked down most of the time. Not much eye contact and no smiles. Restaurant is a little pricey for lunch but the food was worth it. We would eat there again.
author: Michelle H.

description: UPDATE:  Its still my go to for great Mediterranean food.  The service is excellent, and the food is consistently great.  Try the wraps for lunch and the kebab plates are damn good for lunch.
author: Bobby James G.

description: I work by the area and there are many places to go for lunch but Saffron is my favorite place because the food is fresh, healthy, and quick. Also the people are friendly and accommodating to my food requests. My favorite is their Meza plate because you can get 3 different appetizers of your choice and their shawarma low carb plate. Hummus tastes fresh and their falafels are crispy on the outside and moist in the inside. 5 stars are well deserved!
author: Chevonne R.

description: I've been a client of this restaurant for over three year now. Every meal is just delicious, with great mediterranean flavors and combinations. The customer service is outstanding and they always do their best to accommodate client's requests. I strongly recommend Saffron. You will be delighterd.
author: Maria A.

description: Extremely terrible attitude, waiting for seating for like ten minute, and the owner or waiter is just chatting and refuse to answer us. After we seated, wait for another ten minutes to order drinks.
author: Kangyi Z.

description:
I've been going to Saffron 685 for several years now, and it's my favorite Med food restaurant in San Francisco. The food is fresh, and well prepared, and the staff is friendly as well. 

The falafel is particularly flavorful and is my favorite, and the chicken kebabs are always cooked the right amount. We often have Saffron cater for parties, and my guests generally want to know who they are so they can start going. Only downside: I can't wean my kids from the Turkish delight, which is great.

I highly recommend giving Saffron a try. You won't regret it.
author: Mark S.

description: I eat here often and the wraps are great. The wraps come out hot, the meat is perfectly cooked and the hummus is delicious. The owner is very friendly and makes my orders just how I like them. Try it out.
author: Sherry J.

description: The veggie kabob plate keeps me coming back. Something about the way the vegetables are marinated before they're grilled- just delicious. The hummus is always fluffy and fresh and I enjoy my meal surrounded by a clean, modern, internationally inspired decor.  The owner keeps attention to detail and it shows.  Love this place and even though I live across town in the Inner Sunset, it's always on the list as one of my tasty standbys.
author: Allison G.

description:
Living in San Francisco, I hardly ever feel compelled to write a bad review.  This review is for the service...wow does it suck. 

I ordered the chicken kebob salad.  When I ordered I asked the woman at the register if I could have extra dressing, she said no problem.  I paid and left a tip....20ish mins later my salad was ready.  There was no extra dressing so I asked the man who made the salad if I could have extra...he looked very confused and somewhat angry.  He enlisted the help of the other guy behind the counter who also looked confused.  Finally one of them started to fill the container with dressing.  The guy was struggling and the dressing was coming out super slow so I told him that would be okay.  He hands the quarter filled dressing to the other man who proceeds to tell me that would be 55 cents.  55 cents for a tablespoon of dressing?!? At this point I should have told him to take it from the tip that I had already given them but I was so shocked I paid for the dressing. 

I don't think I'll be going back.  The food is not worth the rude service.
author: Jenna W.

description: I've lived upstairs for 4 months and did not try this spot because of the low yelp rating.  But the cold weather, rain combined with a long day and craving for Mediterranean food made me cave and order take out.  I had the lamb shawarma wrap. It was delicious.  So delicious that I had to write this review immediately. The ingredients were fresh and the flavors were perfect.  And the prices are relatively cheap. (Relative because it's soma) I am a little peeved that it took me so long to give this place a chance.  Please don't make my mistake.
author: Ellie N.

description:
Tasty, but overpriced, Mediterranean food. 

Despite its limited menu, Saffron 685 is OK for a quick lunch, if you are in the neighborhood and not averse to paying higher than usual prices, but it is definitely not worth a special trip.  There is no imagination here.  Selections include the standard Mediterranean fare: schwarma, falafel, and lamb, beef, chicken wraps or plates. 

While wraps are not egregiously priced ($9), the $3.50 tariff to upgrade to a plate, which entails the addition of a modicum of salad, some rice, and a dollop of humus, is outrageous. A quick lunch of a chicken kebab plate and a Diet Coke should not cost $15.35.

If you're in the neighborhood and need a falafel fix, Saffron 685 will do, but may damage your lunch budget in the process.
author: CJ G.

description: Fresh and delicious! I mostly go there for lunch breaks and the menu has never disappointed me! I love the falafel plate and all the appetizers. The prices are very reasonable as well. The owner is very friendly which makes your stop even nicer. I highly recommend this place.
author: Hany N.

description: I have to update this review as l tried this place again, l have friends dinner on s Saturday night,  love the ambiance, the food prepared & presented nicely. Try the grilled wild salmon & beet wslnut dip.
author: Jorge B.

description: The food here is great. My favorite is the lamb plate with the tender meat. Their mint lemonade is very refreshing and complements all the dishes. The falafel and tabula salad are some of the best I have had anywhere. The service  is always  friendly and knowledgeable.
author: Miguel L.

description:
This place is my favorite spot in the city! My husband and I love Saffron, there are so many exquisite flavors and everying on the menu is delicious.  it's apparent that the restaurant is passionate about real mederterranian flavor.  

I have to say  I was actually quite taken aback when I read some of the other reviews of this place, saying the service staff was rude. I have never had that experience.  

From the taste of the food to the presentation, we really could not ask for more.  And the best thing is it's all understated....casual elegance. We've gotten to know the owner, he is wonderful and  passionate about his trait. We dine and or take out and I have to say it's the most reasonably priced place i've found. The lamb kebab plate and french fries with the balsamic aoli are simply heaven.  They also have amazing tabouleh, hummus, mint teas, baklava, and latkes. I could go on and on..check it out you won't be dissappointed.
author: Gulnar O.

description: Very rude owner/manager, who has been disrespectful to me personally on several occasions. Despite living less than a block away for six years, I will pay extra fees to order delivery from other Mediterranean restaurants because I choose to support businesses that have good customer service. I really wanted to give the proprietor the benefit of the doubt, and not write a review, however after reading his caustic remarks to other Yelp reviews, I felt the need to chime in. Yelp exists so that we can share this message with the owner: adjust your attitude dude, and you'll see a significant increase in clientele.
author: Drew V.

description:
I only get the falafel plate and it's pretty damn good. 

For some reason, this place reminds me of the @RealSoupNazi
author: Bee D.

description:
The service at Saffron 685 is extremely poor.

I came in at around 7:30pm and placed my order.  No sooner than I'd made myself comfortable at a table, I was told that they were closing and my order had to be to-go.

I said no thanks and began to gather my belongings.  At which point the cashier gave an exasperated sigh and informed me that he already made my food.  He placed my plate on the table without a word.

I was treated like an inconvenience, so I won't trouble them by coming back.
author: Jonathan Z.

description:
I've been going to Saffron for years now. I work down the block and it's become my go to place for a quick, take out meal I can bring back to my desk that tastes great and won't hurt my arteries or wallet.

I'm a huge fan of Mediterranean food and have become quite picky about it, but Saffron's food has exactly the flavor I've come to love about it. Garlicly, lemony, fresh and creamy at the right moments. Don't bother worrying about the service - you order your food and sit down, just trust that its going to be fresh, made by someone who knows what they are doing and will be delicious.

I almost always get a mesa plate so I can sample a lot, but I haven't had a bad dish yet. Big fan of the Baba Ganoush, Dolma and Mojjadara.
author: Josh U.

description: Awesome gluten-free falafel and a very accommodating staff. We also love the lamb, hummus and dolmas.
author: Stacy W.

description: Friendly staff, fast service, and great food. Try their kebab plates: good size and reasonable price. Come earlier, it can get very busy during rush hours.
author: Yulia G.

description: Still love this place five years later. The food is still fresh, the restaurant is still clean. The staff is the same. Standards have stayed high. :)
author: Michele C.

description: Being nice and a having a simple smile when working with customers would go a long way as far as customer service goes. Now I don't expect this every time and/or everywhere i go, but the guy who worked here (not sure if he was the owner/manager or an employee, but it looked like he was the only one working at the time) had an attitude and was just rude. I would give the food 4 stars and the customer  service 0 stars.
author: D M.

description: Food was average and overpriced even by SF standards.  One star less for the very rude (or possibly slightly racist) manager/owner. Too many other good places in SF to bother with this place.
author: Xiaoli J.

description: Great place! I work across the street and have been coming here for a few years. Food is always great! One of my faves in the area.
author: James G.

description: We moved from the east coast four years ago and have been going to Saffron 685 for several years now.  The middle eastern food is excellent.  The owner is a little gruff, but he seems to be making much more of an effort to be customer-friendly in response to reviews.  We typically get the chicken kebab plate with some hummus and baba ghanoush.  Pretty straight forward, but very nicely done and always a welcome change for us.  I like the feel of the place and enjoying a tasty, no-nonsense meal.  Give this place a chance because we need more like it in SF......
author: Al G.

description: The first time I ate here I was underwhelmed.  I gave it a few months and have returned a couple of times and have enjoyed the Veggie Kebab plate.  The veggies were grilled well and the hummus was quite good.  Glad I came back.
author: Flip F.

description:
RUDE is about all I got from this place.

I have NEVER been treated so poorly as a customer in my life! It looks like I'm not alone when I say the service is absolutely awful.  In fact that does not even begin to cover the issue here.  I have never written a completely negative review or even walked out of a restaurant in my life, but there was just no way I was going to eat that food after my experience. I feel that everyone should be spared spending their money at a business that is so clearly ignorant of providing common decency to its patrons.  

I came in for "happy hour" and had the nerve to ask about what was included and was basically mocked for my simple question.  I ordered two dishes for myself and a beer.  (my order was taken after the man who came in 2 minutes behind me)  I was asked if I wanted to eat in or take out (odd because I had ordered a beer)  and I said I would stay and eat in.  I asked to pay with a card, but apparently I did not spend enough money so this was rejected.  Only having $6 cash I said I would have to forget the beer then and I would prefer to take out.  I was then informed I could not take out for happy hour.  So I left because every bit of this was conveyed with hostility.  

It's really a shame, I would have liked to have found a good Mediterranean place to frequent.  But I don't care how good your food is, I will not spend money where my business is so clearly not appreciated.  Too bad because I do not need you food, but judging by how empty the place was you need my business.
author: Christina P.

description:
I have been meaning to check out Saffron 685 for a few months as I recently moved to the neighborhood.  After drooling all over the furniture at Room & Board I decide to grab some lunch.

Many reviewers rate the service and the attitude of the guy pretty low. In my experience the guy barely made eye contact or acknowledged my existence but I wasn't looking for a connection or a date.  As for the service it's not the fastest but its not like the two people that work there are sitting around either.  They are busy cooking, cutting, and serving people.  If you are in a hurry don't go and especially don't order chicken as it takes longer to cook.

Regardless, today I had one of the most fantastic tasting falafel sandwiches in my life. 

I've eaten at many Mediterranean places in my travels throughout the country.  Midwestern friends listen up as you will eat something so tasty and different than you ever experienced. The falafel is perfectly crispy on the outside and soft on the inside which in my opinion enhances the flavor of the chick pea. Plus the sandwich is wrapped with lavish bread and spread with very fresh tahini and hummus. You will notice random pieces of eggplant, fried potatoes, onions and a little hot spice scattered throughout the huge wrap that make for great surprises in every bite.

Also the decor is modern and had a Room & Board feel. They even have floor sitting tables with cushions in the back which would make for a fun experience on a date.

Yes, I'd eat here again!  The guy can be as socialy awkward as he wants as long as he gives me my falafel sandwich as perfectly as the first one I ate there!
author: Kathy J.

description: I love dropping by this place at lunch time and grabbing a wrap to go.  The food is delicious and quick.  The quality is top notch.  The service is friendly.  Why wouldn't you go?  Be like me.  Grab a chicken wrap and take a nice stroll.  You get nourishment and exercise.  Make your body happy already.
author: Terd F.

description: If you want Mediterranean food, this is the place to go. If you haven't tried Mediterranean,  you should. The food is delicious.  It's well -prepared from excellent ingredients.  Give it a try before you go to a Giants game. It's not far from AT&T.
author: Trudy B.

description: It's ok given the limited options in the area. Would like to see more meat on the plates.
author: Dan S.

description:
Good Mediterranean food, though the price can be a little on the high side. The place is rarely very crowded, except around lunch time.

I've had the kabob plates a few times and they were always quite good, especially the beef kebab. You get two skewers plus rice and a couple of other sides, which seem to change every time, but usually include some kind of humus, salad, etc.
author: Ian B.

description: I dont usually like Mediterranean food but the Lamb Kebab Wrap was pretty good. VERY FILLING. A bit too much for me but still a good lunch. Slightly expensive though. Friend got a veggie plate and a drink and it was $20!
author: Jaimie P.

description:
As I continue my quest to find the best shawarma in the city, I decided to try this spot since it's close to my office. I walked in, placed an order for a shawarma wrap without looking at the menu and waited for less than 3 minutes. This is what I received:

- a very symmetrical shawarma that was cold, barely had meat in it, and had french fries in it (since I didn't see the menu, i was not expecting this at all). The taste was bland, but I was really bummed about the lack of meat and the temperature of the food. Needless to say, this place does not offer a good shawarma IMO.
author: Alfonzo J.

description: I had lunch here for the first time today. I really like that there are several vegetarian options. I had the vegetable kebab plate with a pomegranate spritzer. Both delicious. My husband got a falafel wrap and it was excellent also. We plan to go back for sure. Yum!
author: Roca M.

description: I came here with a few friends on a Saturday night, a whole in the wall, once you walk in it opens up, we had 3 plates, the grilled Salmon, lamb & chicken, which all were good but they were out of konafa the dessert l like, bummer.
author: Moez E.

description:
With not a ton of great options in the area, it's nice to have this place here.

While I didn't find the food to be spectacular, it was good overall with a great setting.  I had their lamb shawerma plate, which included rice, hummus and a small salad - everything was good.  I also tried a couple of appetizers (dolmas and falafels) and those were good too. 

The food is cheap and well-priced and the setting is great - very lounge-like.  If you can go during their happy hour special (5pm-7pm everyday), it's well worth it since the sides/appetizers are at a discount.
author: Ken G.

description: Saffron 685 has been a regular staple of our dinner plans (almost always to-go) as long as my wife and i have lived on Potrero Hill.  We typically don't explore too far into the menu because the Shawerma sandwich is as good as it gets in the city - lamb is deliciously seasoned, just enough hot sauce and always french fries.  While they are generally crowded for the lunch hour, its an easy dinner to-go or dine in spot on a weeknight.  Why they are not busier i will never know but it's great to have an option you know won't require a long wait.
author: Justin R.

description: Gave a second chance to this place and couldn't believe how unwelconing this place was. Food,,, I can't even call it good, my Lamb wrap was cold and the bred was at least a day old. And than was this guy; that was pretty rude to a client that didn't say a single complaint, just wanted he's food. I guess that place will be out of business soon because every time I pass by it, it's empty.
author: Mr. Andro P.

description:
Came here for dinner tonight and it's a cute place with nice decor. you can sit on the pillows cross legged and eat your food on a low table. pretty cute. We had a bunch of kabobs (lamb, chicken and shrimp) and some baklava. The baklava had two flavors: walnut and pistachio. both were very good. french fries were like steak fries. the cook looked at me like i was crazy when i asked for ketchup and said they don't carry ketchup at this type of restaurant. sorry my bad. :P

never thought i'd like it but it was pretty good! cute date place.
author: Cynthia C.

description: Very good Lamb Shawarma, love the potatoes in it! Great flavor! Service was good, they accommodated our friend with gluten allergies no problem. Was a quiet night and we had plenty of time to enjoy ourselves without ever feeling rushed. Good food, nice quiet relaxed atmosphere...Great!
author: Lynn M.

description: We live in Potrero Hill and this has become one of our favorite food spots. It's reasonably priced, and the food is excellent and an authentic mix of the best of Mediterranean cuisine. We eat in the restaurant from time to time, but more frequently we order ahead and get food to go. If the owner were to link up with a delivery service, we'd probably order dinner here 5 nights a week, but given the relative ease of parking in this area at night it's not too bad to pick up orders. Personal favorites include the pomegranate roasted pepper walnut dip, the chicken kebab plate, and the heavenly Manaesh bread (combination of olive oil and a mix of spices baked into pita bread -- exquisite!) Great owner, great food and for us at least, great location.
author: Ruth m.

description:
I want this place to be good so badly.  Every time I walk by it smells kinda good and I'm like "oooh Mediterranean food that sounds awesome" but no! no no no! it's a lie! 

dry chicken/meat in their wraps. had their dolma today and it tasted kind of old. or just something was kinda icky about it.
author: Sasha J.

description:
You know what's nice?  That you can get a super crazy delicious falaffel or lamb shawarma and sit anywhere you want because this place is always empty at dinnertime.  I suppose they are more of a lunch place, but hey more space for me and my dinner, so keep on keepin on.

The owner, name I still don't know (sorry dude, next time), has never been anything but 100% genuine and kind and accommodating.  He likes to talk me out of what I ordered and into something he thinks I'll like more, and he's always correct. 

It's fun to sit on the pillows on the floor.

I hate the location.   It's weird.  That doesn't, and won't, keep me from eating the occasional dinner here, but just throwing it out there.
author: Boots B.

description: Dark and depressing venue;  inhospitable waiter who happens to be the only other human being in the place; food was truly awful. The baba ganoush was watery and gross; red beet concoction disgusting; prawn kebab too salty. Just a horrible experience.
author: Roy H.

description: Yummy, consistent, and healthy food. Always a pleasure to order from Ziad, he is so nice and very accommodating.
author: Jessica J.

description:
I have given this place more than a few chances now, and while the food is pretty decent, the one cook there is just down right rude. A lot of the people who reviewed this place to know exactly who I am talking about. He is the taller gentleman with the roman nose and 5 o clock shadow that is always wearing a beanie. The guy doesn't even own the place but still gives attitude as if he does. 
Today the guy screwed up my order and he gets upset at me for doing so? The food is pretty good, but not good enough for where I have to put up with this guys attitude to get it. Most all other people there are pretty nice, particularly the latina cashier,but seriously this guy kinda ruins the whole experience.
author: Alex T.

description:
I love Mediterranean food and was in the mood for some great humus, maybe a kebab or some salads so we headed on over for lunch.  The space is quite nice, loungy and probably great for happy hour, but the food was just OK.

The humus tasted like the American version, not authentic, the kebab was nice and the chicken was juicy, but I just didn't get the feeling this place was authentic or anything special.  The wrap was nice too, but again had the feel of the Americanized wrap.

The service was OK, quite slow and since there was only one other table there a bit concerning at the thought of this place being packed.  

This is probably a good place for a weekday lunch but not worth a special trip and I'm guessing that's where most of the business comes from.
author: Inga W.

description: I'm a big fan of Mediterranean cuisine, I ordered Shawerma plate which was awful and coated $18 which is over priced for a poor quality. Why poor quality? Extremely dry meat and rice which makes it hard to eat. In addition the meat was too salty. I do not recommend this place and I won't come back again.
author: Siavash F.

description:
So I don't write reviews very often... only when something is just so good I have to tell everyone about it, or if it's so God-awful that I hope to save just one person from this horrible experience. I wasn't even finished with my food when I was already thinking I have to WARN PEOPLE ABOUT THIS PLACE. Sorry I had to yell that.

For the love of God don't go to this place. First of all the food was horrible. I ordered a Chicken kabob plate. It came with two tiny skewers where 2/3 was vegetables and even skewered lemons! Really? Talk about filler. There were exactly 6 pieces of sugar-cube size chicken over-cooked of course. The rice was undercooked and crunchy. How do you mess up rice??

But I saved the best for last. So I decided to ask for some balsamic vinegar to put on my dry salad and I go up to the lady that was behind the counter. I ask her for the vinegar and she's about to get it for me when the manager or owner (some middle-eastern looking guy with a beanie) looks at her and gives her a little nod or something. She stops immediately and looks at me with this futile look. I had a hard time processing what just happened but after a few moments it just dawned on me that he just told her not to get it for me. The only reason I could think of was because a short line had just formed. Really??? I just paid $12 for this garbage kabob and she can't take 30 seconds to get me some balsamic vinegar?!

Anyways, places like this will continue to get customers because of the great location, but if I can discourage just one person from experiencing the same bad experience that I did and keep them from getting the customer then I'll be happy.
author: Andreas K.

description: Really delicious, super fresh, well made food. Yum!
author: Kelly S.

description:
This is my go to place for decent kebabs and complete isolation.

Thank God he gets a ton of business during the lunch rush because every time I go there for dinner, it's so empty that I swear I can hear the muffled screams of developers coming from the Adobe sex dungeon.
author: Patrick C.

description: I work near this spot and I love their food. The place is clean, always has great beats playing in the background, the staff is kind and quick service. The chef is really serious, but you can tell he takes great pride in the food he makes. The ingredients are fresh and of excellent quality. I recommend it if you're ever in the SF Design district.
author: Herlinda H.

description: Just celebrated my 44th Birthday and wanted to go back into my old neighborhood and visit Saffron for lunch as I used to go there all the time when I lived just above it at the Metro at Showplace Square. I am always greeted by the owner with kindness and the food is always amazing!
author: Shelley R.

description:
Went to lunch with my friend over the weekend.  I got the chicken shish kabob wrap and my friend got the lamb shwerma.  We shared an order of french fries.

The wrap was more than adequate for a lunch entree.  In fact, by the time I got to the end, I was just eating the chicken and vegetables.  The sauce it came with was a great mixture of citrus and spicy with just enough garlic to make my taste buds jump for joy.

The were fresh cut fries done just perfectly and the garlic dip it came with was heavenly.  We had to ask for more because we kept fighting over it. I also ordered a pomegranate spritzer that was tart and refreshing at the same time.  

The decor is cool and inviting.  There were spacious booths and lounge couches.  Definitely a great place to chill with friends.

I will most likely stop by again if I'm in the neighborhood.
author: Judi M.

description:
I would LOVE to make this place my local take-out. but I would rather go hungry than suffer the off-hand, sneering service. 

If you are a masochist, I would recommend this place to you.  You will come out HALF the person you were when you went in.
author: ann c.

description: Bad customer service. Just rude, no smile on face while dealing with customers. Serving size is small for their prices. I would try it again though just to give it another chance.
author: Prateek G.

description:
Ok, so the dolmas are pretty good - but how hard are they to screw up? And the falafel, as others have mentioned, was sorta dry in parts - not the worst I've ever had, but by far not the best. 

My real reason for the crappy review, is that I walked in, with a mere 2 people ahead of me, and wound up waiting for 30 minutes for PRE-PREPARED FOODS. Meanwhile, I watched (literally) 15 other orders, that took cooking, go out before mine. 

I watched the guy make my meal, and it took him all of a minute in total to prepare. 

Not to mention how RUDE the guy prepping the food was...several people walked up to the counter to order, and he sneered at all of us (one by one) and just pointed to the register....there's no signs to say "order here" anywhere, and the logical place to order would have been where he was prepping the orders...not walk INTO the restaurant to the register to place an order. Common sense people, use it. 

At any rate...while the next closest Greek/Mediterranean style spot is over on 2nd or 3rd @ Bryant, which is several blocks further for me to travel from my office for lunch, I'll still make the extra long trip after this experience. 

Sorry kids, but in the world of lunch spots in business heavy areas, you really have to be on point - clearly the folks running the show at Saffron 685 don't have a clue.
author: Marco M.

description: Had their lamb shawarma.  It was good enough.  Good option if you're here and want that sort of thing.
author: Russel H.

description:
We snuck over here for a quick/light lunch between a wedding ceremony and the reception. The space is surprisingly large given the small store front. Jessica C. ordered the latkes (mmm. Mediterranean hash browns) and we picked the lam shawerma plate. I don't know what Jessica C. is referring to, but I love lamb. Never has lamb tasted like barn before. Both of our dishes were faboo. It totally hit the spot since we were starving. The wedding ceremony started at 12:30 and none of us ate yet.

To cap off our late lunch, the man behind the counter brought us some baklava to try. It was sooo good. If we weren't already going to be attending a wedding reception where there's cake I'd probably ordered some more to go.
author: Henry L.

description:
A Greek Islands cruise would be nice about now. Santorini. Some ouzo. Some feta cheese. A little Zorba dance. That would be the life. Not gonna happen soon, so where do I go to replicate that experience?

New eateries are popping up amid the design and jewelry centers between SOMA and Portrero Hill. For lunch today, I met a good friend who works at Advent, which is across the street from this cleanly decorated Mediterranean place. It definitely looks fairly spanking new with freshly painted walls and accessories in orange and red. It doesn't really evoke the blazing sun that would hit you on the deck of Onassis' yacht in the Aegean Sea. No, it definitely feels more like you're in a place frequented by pale-faced worker bees stuck behind network terminals in cubicles.

And it sure felt new. The first thing I noticed was the lack of eye contact among the staff busily preparing the orders. They looked determined to follow whatever instructions they were told to make the falafel and shawerma dishes. Their intense level of concentration meant nary a smile while I was in the queue wondering when they were going to ask for my order. Alas, a voice from the register beckoned, and the smiling hostess took it.

I ordered the $11.50 Lamb Shawerma Plate, which was a pretty hefty portion of grilled lamb shards served up with a fresh thick pool of tahini sauce and fresh vegetables. It came with a tasty hummus and a bowl of marinated bean salad. The crispy lavash came in a large folded sheet that you tear up with some dexterity in order to scoop up the ingredients. My friend ordered the same thing but intriguingly, instead of the bean salad, she got a bowl of yogurt sauce. Neither of us knew why, but I chalk it up to rookie employees.

Truth be told, I think their prices are a bit on the high side for what they serve, even though they are marginally more plush than say, Gyro King in Civic Center or Oasis Grill in FiDi. But the food is good, and I'm sure I'll come back after they get more comfortable with their routines.

FOOD - 4 stars...good due to fresh ingredients, a bit pricey though
AMBIANCE - 3.5 stars...they have cushions for floor seating, but I feel naked without my hookah pipe, so I passed on that
SERVICE - 3.5 stars...they're trying, they're trying
TOTAL - 4 stars...new Mediterranean eateries are always welcome in my extended 'hood...but I want to break some plates and dance the Sirtaki shoulder-to-shoulder with the staff....ooom-pah!
author: Ed U.

description: It's a shame a place like this exits in a city like San Francisco . The worst service I have ever revived in my life . The food is also so bad not sure if people who thought that this place had good food actually have working taste buds . Avoid at all costs
author: Feras I.

description:
UPDATE:
The guy emailed me an in an awkward way kind of apologized to me? I'n not sure, but he definitely put a lot of the blame on me. After reading through the other reviews on here and noticing this is a recurring theme with him, I just told him he comes of as an a-hole and any problems I encountered were his, not mine.

Oh, and he doesn't hate bikes. He just hates when people bring them into his restaurant. Still don't know why. Don't care. F this guy and his over-priced (although admittedly tasty) food.

--------------------------

This guy HATES bicycles.

I've walked to this place twice before. Both really good experiences. Today I decided to ride my bike there. When I got there, I noticed there is no place within sight to lock up a bicycle. Since I was ordering to go, I thought I could just stand in line with my bike, get my food and go.

As I try to walk in, the skinny Croatian (I assumed he was middle eastern because of the food, but happy to find out he's not) guy yells, "No bikes!" and points to the door. I was a little shocked at how he decided to let me know about this rule, but I backed out and looked for a place to lock it up. I found an illegal place to lock it, but it was out of sight. No worries. I wasn't going to be long.

I come back in without my bike and stand in line behind 3 girls. He takes their orders then sends them to the cashier while he puts some earlier orders together. He finishes putting those orders together after about 6 or 7 minutes. Then he puts the 3 girls orders together. After I've been standing there for 10-15 minutes, he continues to ignore me standing right in front of him.

Some other guy behind the counter tells me to go to the cashier to pay. I guess because I broke one of his rules to which I immediately complied, I don't get to eat at his place any more.

I guess I won't be going back there. Too bad. The lamb shawerma was good, but I can get just as good meals from nearby places who don't mind that I bring my bike in when I'm taking out.
author: Brad D.

description: We've eaten here several times--on a holiday and weekends when it is less busy--and the quality of the food to be excellent. The falafels are gluten-free which means they are not made with flour or filler so there is more garbanzo, parsley, and cilantro. High quality ingredients make for an excellent falafel plate, tabouli made with italian parsley, soups, and delicious beet dip (you must try this!), and spritzers. We eat falafels all over town and find the quality of the food at Saffron 685 to be a cut above most others. So if you are paying a little more, it's for a good reason. I can see why others commented on the lack of warm service but found that it improved when I made the effort to engage and express interest in the food.
author: M.D. L.

description: kind of a strange location and a dark restaurant but decent food that hit the spot.  I guess they get a lot of lunch customers from the surrounding design district.  A little expensive for what you get but good solid food.  I had the lamp kebob plate, meat pieces were small but tasty, the hummus and baba ganoush were delicious.
author: Matt A.

description: Really great interior - there was a cool seating area where you could sit on pillows instead of chairs. Fun vibe! The food was also delicious.
author: Richard F.

description: I'm writing this review sitting in the restaurant...I work nearby and have been coming here for 2.5 years. I don't know why at this point. Every time the service is slow and spotty. Someone in my small group always has their food served after the rest of us have finished. The food is not that great either, especially considering it 's on the pricier side. Save your time and money. There are much better Mediterranean restaurants in the city....
author: Mindy A.

description:
Stopped by here on a whim to grab a bite to eat, and I wish I didn't.  I ordered the lamb sandwich, which was just okay.  there was nothing particularly special about it, and what made it a bit worse was the server/manager.  this guy was miserable.  there was no other staff in the place besides him.  Had to get up a few times to ask for water, and he wouldn't even fill my glass to the top.  Also, had some of my partners falafel sandwich, which was depressing.  the falafel was dry, and in two huge pieces, which threw off the proportion of the wrap.  we also ordered the mint lemonade, which was bitter, and had a bad aftertaste.  overall, just not very good food, or service.  

Anyways, considering there are not much choices in the area, I imagine this place fills up for lunch during the week, but not because it has good food, probably because most of us only have a short lunch break.  If you want good falafel, check out sunrise deli.
author: David M.

description:
The guy working behind the counter (might be the owner?) sure was a character-and not the good kind.  I don't know if it's b/c it was dead and the guy had nothing better to do, but it seemed his agenda to pick on us.  First off, I went to grab a beer from the fridge and he tries to sell me hard on the housemade tea.  Uhm. No. I want my beer thanks. Random.

Then, when my friend went up to ask for a side of tzakiki sauce for his lamb wrap, the guy goes off  on him.  Lecturing him for a good 5 minutes on how the two don't go together.   Finally, when my friend went to ask for a to go box, the guy gave attitude and asked why we need one. It seemed he was offended there were leftovers.

As for my food it was alright.  The lamb schwarma I ordered and rice it came with was dry.  And the guy didn't even warn me about scorching the plate when he brought it out!

You might wonder why I haven't given this place one star.  Well, the second star is for the cool, lounge like setting. I would've come back to enjoy it more and check out happy hour, if it wasn't for scary guy.  I did not appreciate how pressured and stressed he made me feel the whole time.
author: Shree R.

description:
I'd give it 2 and a half stars.  It is a bit hit or miss and a curious little joint.  I'd have to say the lamb schwarma salad was very nice and plentiful.  The falafel wrap was a mixed bag, the wrap was dry and too crumbly, the falafel though was not which often happens when people over cook them.  
The owner/server was accommodating enough as I like my dolma heated not cold.  Makes a world of difference and with some heat the grape leaves were quite good.
The lemonade was the best I've ever had without doubt.  Subtle, not too sweet but enough lemon to make you want two.
I think the search will continue and I didn't try the humus which to me is the litmus test for Mideastern restaurants, like salsa is for Mexican eateries.
If you're in the area it will fill your urges but I wouldn't go out of my way.
author: john b.

description:
I was pretty happy with my Falafel Wrap ($6.50) that i had for lunch here. It was a little heavy on the onions and there were french fries in it, which was a bit weird, but all in all, i liked it. The food is good and it comes out quick. 

One thing that happened was very odd. My friend and I were having lunch and she was just about finishing up. She literally placed her last bite into her mouth when someone came by to grab her plate from her. She hadn't even finished chewing. It was a bit awkward. I understand that they are trying to be efficient but I think there is a fine line between that and rushing people through. Otherwise the service was good and provided with a smile. 

The restaurant is a cute little place with comfortable cushions and sofas everywhere. I actually kind of wish they had more normal tables. 

There is a theory here that if a guy and a girl come to eat her, the girl will get her food first. So far the theory has proven to be true.
author: Mariko F.

description:
Saffron 685 is within walking distance of our place - like 45 seconds walking distance so it gets some extra points for convenience, and it's also super tasty. 

On one hand, I'm amazed that this one dude apparently runs the entire show solo, cranking out some damn fine vittles. On the other hand, talking to the dude, ordering, paying... all are uneasy at best. Sometimes he comes off as a total jerk, other times it's just uncomfortable. I don't mind too much - it's good stuff! But my fiance hates going in there. So we don't go so much any more. 

I wish he was friendlier. Maybe he should go hang out with Emily at Clothespin Cleaners for some tips on being more personable. 

In closing: amazing food in a cool room, but an uncomfortable environment.
author: Surj G.

description:
I understand that there are some people who hate kids. I used to be one of those people. I get that kids and restaurants have a sordid history, and believe you me this review would be more forgiving had I thought that our behavior had warranted it, but I have to pull a mama-bear with this one.

We met some friends and family from out of town for a quick, weekday evening meal.  The restaurant was empty aside from our party of 6 (5 adults and 1 toddler). The server's sheer, undisguised disgust at our presence was alarming. 

We were there for less than thirty minutes. The toddler, who did not eat or make a mess, apparently rendered us third-class customers. Steerage diners who don't deserve eye contact or communication beyond grunts.  When the vermin, erm I mean child, sat on one of the unused sofas (with supervision, and NO food, no sticky fingers, no dirty diapers, no graffiti markers) for less than one minute, and the owner ran over to fluff the cushions almost immediately after we got up. Um. 

Prior to this, we have been regular, near weekly takeout customers, but we will not return. It's a shame considering that the nearby Mission Bay neighborhood is exploding with young families wanting to patronize local businesses.
author: Who Knows N.

description:
I kinda want this to be 1.5 stars since my boyfriend thought his falafel wrap wasn't too bad, but I tasted it, and it was just mediocre.

I ordered the lamb kabob plate.  for $12, it should have been at least edible.  It wasn't.  The rice was either extremely stale, over very undercooked.  We're talking CRUNCHY, and so lemony, it was hard to swallow, and I loooooove lemon.  The food aside from that was just "meh".  Not very flavorful, stale, watery hummus, etc.

The guy behind the counter was surly.  I asked if there was such a thing as ordering one latke (so my boyfriend and I could share), and he said no (which is fair), but gave me a look like I had asked him to serve up slices of his first-born son.  When I told him I couldn't have the olive he had used as a garnish for allergy reasons, he was visibly annoyed.  You could see on my plate where he had scooped it out, but didn't replenish the hummus it was sitting in.  He sternly told my boyfriend we couldn't sit in the lounge area even though we were, aside from another couple, the only people in the entire place.  Oh, and if that guy is reading this?  If you hand someone a plate and you know there's something extremely hot on it?  TELL THEM.  I picked up my kabob and I now have a blister on my index finger, so thanks for that.
author: Samantha W.

description:
This place is great if you need a quick cheap bite (order at the counter) and have your choice of chilling in a lounge-y environment with little tables and square cushy ottomans or tables with a low-key environment. 

Mint lemonade was really yummy, friend had falafel plate which she said she's had better. I ordered the lamb shawerma sandwich which is not the best I've had.
