A woman who doesn't speak English walks out of the kitchen carrying food and calling out a person's name, while wandering through the spacious seating area, until someone flags her to take their food.  Why not just use a number system like most counter/delivery restaurants (Firewood, et al)? But if the staff wasn't so rude, I probably would give this place 2 stars.  I'll never eat here again.
author: Michael S.

description:
We stopped over this past Saturday for lunch after the family resource fair. I wanted to give more stars for the food (it was pretty good)--but the incredibly rude man behind the counter ruined the meal. 

When we walked in the place was pretty empty, which should have been a sign for us to head out the door. But I was in the mood for falafel and baba ganoush. Our food was ordered and we sat down with our 9 month old baby girl. 

She promptly grabbed the nearby spoon and started banging on the table (a common behavior for babies this age). Before we could stop her, like good parents, the rude man  behind the counter came over, gave her a plastic fork (yes, a fork) and insisted she stop because she was going to wreck the table. Seriously?! 

After food came, we were eating and my boyfriend's water glass was empty. We very politely asked for more, and instead of pulling out the cold pitcher in the refrigerator where he got our first glasses, he took the glass and walked all the way over to the kitchen sink and filled it up with sink water. Now, it's not that I'm snobby about water, but the entire action of walking farther than the nearby pitcher to give him water from the sink seemed quite insulting. 

He did not talk or acknowledge us--and spent pretty much the entire time trying to look busy. Absolutely ZERO (or if it's possible, negative one) for service. We felt like we were bothering him. 

I will not ever come back to Saffron 685 because of the poor customer service. There are many other places with Mediterranean/Middle Eastern food. If I'm going to go out and spend my money, I expect some general pleasantry and to feel like my business matters. 

PS: The falafel looked wonderful on the outside, but incredibly dry on the inside. The tziki had excellent flavor but the yogurt was thin and runny. Boyfriend said lamb shawarma was good sized and generally flavorful. Overall, typical dishes--neither really good or really bad. 
***********************************************************
Hi Nicole,
 
ziad t. has sent you a message on Yelp:
 
Saffron 685
 
"Hi there, thanks for your honest opinion in writing about Saffron.
I'd like to clear up a few things if I may.
The place was empty because we have an engagement party @ 5.00 PM, the place was booked for that, I got you in because I saw you coming back and forth and checking the menu outside.
The place is not designed for kids, the interior is more for parties and people coming on a dates.
The reason I did not give the gentleman water from the pitcher because I was just cleaned and refilled the pitcher beside when you were asked for a drink you said yourself that you wanted a tap water right?
Sorry you found the service bad and the food no good not really bad, however people say we have the best shawerma, the best kebab, the best fries, the best soups, top it up being great place for parties and very efficient service, check the web please, I'm neither lying nor bragging, people out the door here @ lunch time.
Sorry again for the hall trouble, bless your heart & prosper to you, the baby & gentleman
Your server"
author: Nicole H.

description:
The food is good, but as a lunch destination, it is just too expensive. 

I agree completely with some of the other posters, they have a very interesting menu, and some very tasty looking things behind the glass, but the price to make a "complete" meal is nuts.

The food preparation is too slow and the counter is positioned poorly for a line, with the cooks at the restaurant's entrance, making it appear like a normal cafeteria where you order at the glass as you enter and pay at the end, while it is in fact the other way around here. They seem to run a skeleton staff.

I happily will and do put up with all of the above in the numerous other small restaurants in the area, because the rest offer good food AND good prices.

If I pay $25 for a complete meal, the situation above is unacceptable.

I have gone from time to time, but I won't be back.
author: Z B.

description: Terrific place!!!  Fast service, warm family like and just attentive enough to make you feel special.  Great for accomadating customers for special occasions!!! Great place to treat someone to.
author: Nannah G.

description: Came here with three other guys. Two of the guys had been before multiple times and ordered the lamb shawerma. Being a lamb-lover as well as someone who listens to recommendations, I got the lamb shawerma as well. And loved it! I'd never had Mediterranean food before, but I would very willingly eat tons of it if everything were as tasty as this was.
author: Chris L.

description: I'll update my review because I've been assured that the rude counter woman has been let go. I work near this place and occasionally treat myself to their delicious food. They have some unique offerings here and I think their food always tastes really fresh and is very expertly prepared. Their seating area is very warm and welcoming and a true oasis. I believe they are striving for good customer service but may have been burned by some bad employees. Still, if you are looking for good food in the lower Potrero Hill area, Saffron should be at the top of your list.
author: Caroline K.

description: Came here for happy hour on a Tuesday - not by choice, we were just starving and passed by this place as we were driving - so we found it by accident. We were the only ones at the restaurant and it was dead. We order the lamb sherwma, appz and soup, which was all reasonably priced. We've had better mediterranean food, but we thought the food was good and if iwe find our hungry-selves in the area...we might come back.
author: JG W.

description: Very tasty, fresh food, very nice room. We had several vegetarian things and all were excellent.
author: vadim g.

description: I went here on a wednesday night and it was deserted.  This place is kinda odd--it's cheap "order at the counter" style mediterranean food, with a lot of the dishes already prepared and sitting ready to be scooped out, except it has really cute decor like a nice sit-down restaurant.  I liked sitting on pillows on the floor.  They had one guy being cashier/server/busboy/chef and he was only serving us and one other table, although somehow service was still slow.  Food-wise it's pretty good for the price.  Their fattoush salad didn't look that great although I didn't try any.  The bean salad tasted a little too canned.  The mojidara was awesome, the tabouleh was yummy, and the pita was fresh and toasty.  Their desert was pretty awesome though - some mesh of crunchy threads dripping in honey -- tasted like baklava.
author: Lisa C.

description: This is a great little spot on Townsend in SOMA.  Really friendly staff who make you feel right at home.  Nice and fresh.  Although I was not a real fan of the hummus.  Too "light" for me.  This place would be great for a small party or baby shower.  With the couches and table set up, it is MADE for entertaining a group.
author: Kari G.

description: The food is decent to average. I've been there three separate times and each time I am confronted with the same rude guy. He is a tall dark haired man wearing a beanie with pointy sideburns. The last time I kindly asked him if pita came with the Meza salad and he whispered, "Hold Your Horses" under his breath.  He really appears to not like his job and I think he works there out of obligation. Whoever owns this place should speak with him about a career change. The place has potential while they try to appear  high- end.  I just wish the service was better. I will never go their agaion after giving the place three separate  chances.  For the price and taste I would rather eat at "Truly Mediterranean" in the Mission.
author: Erik G.

description: I used to eat here all the time.  I used to order the lamb shawerma, faafel wrap and other wraps.  I eventually realized why I wasn't enjoying them the way I should.  It was because
author: Edward F.

description: Great food (have tried several of their items and you can't go wrong with any of them), love the Pomegranate Spritzer, nice atmosphere.  And I don't mind spending extra $ as long as the food is delicious and the service is good.
author: Isabella S.

description:
i live upstairs from this place so i go here quite often.  by far the best lamb shawarma and chicken kaboob dishes i've ever had.  i always order extra hummus too as its homemade and delicious!  

highly recommended!
author: Anson T.

description: Found this on Yelp and the reviews looked good.  We were not disappointed.  We had the schwerma plate and the lamb kebab plate, as well as a latke plate.  I wanted to try the mujadrah, the server suggested replacing the rice on the lamb kebab plate with mujadrah, which was an excellent suggestion.  The food was all very good, good portion size and fair pricing.  I had a piece of walnut baklava for dessert and it was perfect -- not overly sweet, good balance of texture.  I love the seating choices here, too.  There are a few regular tables, plus a couple couches with coffee tables, and some low tables with floor cushions.  Very comfy.  We will come back here.
author: Pat H.

description: i used to work in the area. whenever my office craves Mediterranean, this is always the place we order from. the phone-in orders are nice and simple and in 30mins or so, the order's ready for pickup. their kebab wraps are so good. i usually get the chicken one. i must say it's a bit pricey at around close to $10, but it's so worth it. the portion is huge, i usually just end up eating half of it and the other for dinner or as a late afternoon snack. also we would typically order sides, and i must say, you can't go wrong w/ their hummus or dolmas. it's absolutely delicious! definitely hits the spot when you're craving Mediterranean.
author: mai c.

description: I was really excited to have this place in my work neighborhood, esp since I love this cuisine and have found no restaurants in SF that compare to the ones back east.  We've given this place a few chances and although the food is pretty good, the staff there loses focus on customer service when they are in a rush, which is normally lunch time.  I think that's the lamest excuse for any restaurant.  You know you are gonna get busy, so just get it together!  Don't be rude to your customers, or deny them choices that your menu clearly states they are entitled to.  Take a deep breath and remember that customers appreciate good food, and GREAT service more than quick food, crappy service.  Plus, its very pricey for what you get. Its no secret how much that food actually costs.  Its not like its exotic ingredients.  All around disappointment when you weigh all that's important to me in the experience.
author: Shanni L.

description:
I went to this restaurant at first for a meeting with coworkers and I fell in love!  I have been back a minimum of once a week now.  First of all, the space, decor and ambiance is excellent.  Great modern and clean feel with awesome music always playing!  Most importantly it is very clean and tidy. The service is excellent.  The owner really takes the time to connect with customers to his restaurant.  He is usually the guy taking your order and preparing your meal.  He is extremely outgoing and personable.  And last but not least THE FOOD!
Wow the food is so delicious!  At first I only knew of and ordered the lamb shawarma.  But after going to Saffron several times I tried other items like kabobs and sides like Baba Ganoush, falafels, etc. ! Everything is so fresh and tasty.  I just want to order a little bit of everything every time I go now.  Last but not least, if I just want a quick sweet treat- Saffron has amazing baklava!

Go there asap and enjoy!
author: christina d.

description: Baba ganoosh.. Hummus.. Lentils... Oh my! Everything here looks so good, it's tempting to take a big gaggle of friends along so I can try everything on the menu. It's important for the owner to have the freshest ingredients - just ask him. I just hope he brings back his soups. Try to ask him when you place your order! Revolution! But in the meantime, my boyfriend swears by (and salivates from)  the mint lemonade, and I've never had a bad shwarma experience.
author: Sarah D.

description: Fabulous food that is very fresh and yummy.  Very clean restaurant with efficient and personable staff.  My favorite lunch spot!
author: Samantha G.

description: Food is decent but WAY overpriced and portions are small.  Like $12 for a chicken kebob plate with about 5 pieces of chicken?  Come on!
author: Sunil M.

description: they have a really good lamb shawerma  and the saffron rice pudding is very interesting. the falafel i had was a bit on the dry side. it is a little pricey, but it really is quite tasty. the other thing i noticed when i ate in was that the space was huge, but they haven't used it very wisely. some interior design help would be nice. i would definitely give it a try.
author: Kerri B.

description: Saffron 685 is an excellent place for Mediterranean food.  My office is across the street from the restaurant, so... I frequent it whenever I can.  Their food is always extremely fresh and flavorful.  The owner is also very nice and outgoing, working hard, but making sure that everyone is happy with his food and service.  I usually get the Chicken Kebab plate with dolmas (stuffed grapeleaves) or tabbouleh as the salad.  Their lamb shawarma/falafel are also yummy.  It's a bit pricey at $12 for a lunch plate, however, the quality of the food that's made to order (right off of the grill) makes up for the price tag.  It's a great place for a sit down or take out lunch and has a special ambience in its dining area with a warm design palette.  I highly recommend it.
author: Anne A.

description: Our new hangout is this restaurant.  The food is fresh and delicious.  It has been very lovingly decorated.  We're delighted to have a quiet place to meet our friends too.  Grab a beautiful silk pillow and enjoy yourself.
author: Rebecca W.

description: I am new to posting on Yelp, even though I use it all the time for reference.  (Thank you, everybody.)  We just grabbed dinner tonight in one of our favorite nabe spots, and I wanted to share our yummy dinner experience.  We live in Potrero and love Saffron for take out or eat in.  We take out about once a week and always enjoy the shawarma, lentil/bulgar salad, falafel, and other goodies that the owner recommends.  This is good mediterranean food served with care and a smile in a cute space.  Plus, we get a kick out of the owner and his charm.
author: Meredith M.

description: The food is good.  I especially like the hummus, mojjadra (which I like to mix with my hummus), bean salad, tzazekee, the chicken kabob sandwich and the lamb shawerma plate.  I like when I go there and the lamb is sizzling on the grill...the smell makes me even hungrier than when I first walk in.  The ambience (the wall colors, plants, music, the lighting) complements the type of cuisine being served.  In addition to this, if you ever get the opportunity to get dessert, I highly recommend the konafa and the saffron rice pudding.  The outer layer of the konafa is crunchy and sweet with creamy cheese inside.  The saffron rice pudding is light, not heavy and not overly sweet.  It's not your typical rice pudding, but it's good nontheless.  It's worth a try.  The staff are friendly, and the restaurant itself is clean.
author: erica d.
